companie: ProjectGrowth
intro:
Our client, a fast-growing consulting organization that specializes in affiliate marketing/PR support for DTC businesses, is looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Marketing Operations Associate to join their team. Our client works closely with various DTC brands to streamline their affiliate marketing processes, optimize operations, and drive results. This role is ideal for someone who is equally focused on quality and efficiency, a critical thinker who not only executes but also takes ownership in improving processes. You’ll support the team with operational tasks, affiliate program management, and optimizing workflows through AI tools.

Location:
Fully-Remote (Work from Home), 9 AM - 5 PM EST

Key Responsibilities

Affiliate Program Support: Assist in managing affiliate networks, relationships, and partnerships from the backend, ensuring smooth operation of affiliate programs for DTC brands.

Operational Support: Provide operational and administrative support, including but not limited to organizing data, maintaining spreadsheets, and preparing reports.

Task Optimization: Utilize AI tools to optimize workflows, automate processes, and enhance operational efficiency.

Creative Problem-Solving: Proactively identify and implement solutions to improve affiliate marketing processes and operational effectiveness.

Data Management: Support data entry, tracking, and management in spreadsheets, ensuring accuracy and timely updates.

Process Improvement: Suggest and drive improvements in affiliate program operations, contributing to the overall success of the business.

Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams, including marketing and sales, to support the execution of affiliate campaigns and meet client needs.

Learning & Adaptability: Be open to learning new tools, systems, and processes to enhance skills and drive better results for the business.

Qualifications

2+ years of experience in operations or marketing support, preferably in a DTC or affiliate environment.

Experience with affiliate networks and managing DTC brand partnerships is highly advantageous.

Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills; ability to proactively manage tasks and processes.

Experience using AI tools to optimize tasks and workflows is a plus.

Excellent organizational skills with a strong attention to detail.

Comfortable working with spreadsheets and Excel for data tracking, reporting, and analysis.

Solution-driven mindset with a focus on achieving operational excellence.

Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

Operational mindset, adaptable to various tasks and willing to learn new processes.

What Success Looks Like

Operational Efficiency: Streamlining affiliate program operations and achieving measurable improvements in efficiency and accuracy.

Affiliate Program Growth: Successful management and growth of affiliate programs, ensuring smooth operation and high-quality partnerships.

Task Optimization: Demonstrated ability to optimize workflows and processes through AI tools, resulting in time savings and improved productivity.

Creative Problem Solving: Effectively identifying and resolving issues, ensuring that tasks are completed efficiently and accurately.

Data Accuracy: Ensuring that all data is accurately tracked and reported, supporting business decisions and client success.

Opportunity
This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing company and play a key role in optimizing affiliate marketing and operations for DTC brands. If you are a motivated, detail-oriented individual with a passion for operational excellence and affiliate marketing, we would love to have you on the team.

Application Process:To be considered for this role these steps need to be followed:
Fill in the application form

Record a video showcasing your skill sets

companie: Unilever Schweiz GmbH
intro:
ABOUT UNILEVER


With 3.4 billion people in over 190 countries using our products every day, Unilever is a business that makes a real impact on the world. Work on brands that are loved and improve the lives of our consumers and the communities around us. We are driven by our purpose: to make sustainable living commonplace, and it is our belief that doing business the right way drives superior performance. At the heart of what we do is our people – we believe that when our people work with purpose, we will create a better business and a better world.
At Unilever, your career will be a unique journey, grounded in our inclusive, collaborative, and flexible working environment. We don’t believe in the ‘one size fits all’ approach and instead we will equip you with the tools you need to shape your own future.
CATEGORY INTRODUCTION


This position combines the best of strategic influence and operational impact. you’ll lead the execution of Nutrition category in collaboration with our CBD teams, utilizing data insights and customer-centric tools to meet critical KPIs (growth, profitability, market share) at the customer and channel level. If you thrive in a high-energy, performance-driven environment, enjoy fostering cross-functional partnerships, and are motivated by delivering results, this role is your platform to make a measurable impact.
JOB PURPOSE


The CSP assistant manager will drive Morocco Nutrition customer agenda, ensuring category and channel plans are implemented effectively and adapted to meet customer needs. This involves accountability to ensure platform / category verticals objectives are delivered via channel & customer growth strategies & supported by holistic trade investment. You will ensure our category growth strategy is reflected in all customer and market plans, directly impacting the shopper experience – working closely with platform marketing & CSP & delivering via CBD teams.
WHAT WILL YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES BE


S&OP
Responsible for forecasting by category/channel across categories Onboard the CBD inputs into the S&OP. Owns the trade activity grid by Category/ channel/customer
Category Growth Strategies


Localise (Develop and deploy) CGS at channel and customer level, Work closely with Brand, CMI, NRM, Shopper Marketing to build Customer sell-in
Innovation


Define national innovation & launch plan to channels/customers. D4C/D4R: executes locally AND integrates upstream into BU
Targets and Budgets


Allocate USG targets and investment to deliver strategy by channel and customer Define budgets by channel and customer to deliver UOM target from BU. Manage the TTS spending E2E
Pricing and promotions, Mix


Own Pricing & Promo strategy in collaboration with marketing. Lead monthly forecasting process and report and own Pricing & Promotions Mix NRM:  Ownership of L4 and L5 along with CBD
Execution


Deploy strategically aligned commercial plan in Market via CBD Deploy launch plans to channels/customers to ensure strength of execution Define channel / Customer Execution: (SoS, TDP). Shopper / Digital marketing led Assist the CBD team in formalizing the annual JBPs for key customers in the country.
Capability


Deploy core capabilities required to win by Channel and Customer. Catman / Shopper / NRM
WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED


Experiences & Qualifications


3 years relevant Category & Customer experience 1-2 years Account management experience is an advantage Customer Facing experience combined with Brand Building experience is ideal Shopper Marketing or Brand Building experience is desirable
competences:
Skills


Innovation mindset Commerce channels execution and digital business models Commercial Strategy and Business Acumen /NRM Category Growth Management Data-Drive Mindset Entrepreneurial Leadership Digital Commerce Customer and Retailer Understanding Customer Relationship Stakeholder Management Process Thinking (Discipline) Strategic Thinking
Leadership


You are an inclusive motivator of people. Your team deliver with real passion, growing and learning from each other whilst delivering quick wins. You are still responsible for your own results and as a manager, you also need to motivate others to deliver with passion, creating an inclusive and engaging climate around you. You can balance challenge with support and coaching. You understand the wider business context and you are emotionally intelligent enough to motivate people to deliver what is needed.
Critical SOL (Standards of Leadership) Behaviors

+ PERSONAL MASTERY: Sets high standards for themselves. Has emotional intelligence to take feedback, manage mood and motivations, and build empathy for others. + PASSION FOR HIGH PERFORMANCE: Generates intensity and focus to motivate people to deliver results at speed. Takes personal responsibility and accountability for execution and results.
+ TALENT CATALYST: Invests in people – coaches individuals and teams to realize their full potential. Creates an inclusive climate, empowering everyone to be at their best.
+ PURPOSE & SERVICE: Has humility, understanding that leadership is service to others, inside and outside Unilever.
+ CONSUMER LOVE: Invests time inside and outside to understand the needs of consumers.
+ BUSINESS ACUMEN: Creates sustainable growth with purpose, engaging different partners across the system for change.
Unilever embraces diversity and encourages applicants from all walks of life! This means giving full and fair consideration to all applicants and continuing development of all employees regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, and pregnancy and maternity.
Vielfalt ist Teil unserer Kultur!
Wir arbeiten stets daran, dass Du Dich bei uns respektiert und sicher fühlst und jeden Tag Dein authentisches Selbst einbringen kannst - unabhängig von Geschlecht, Alter, Herkunft, körperlicher Einschränkungen oder sexueller Orientierung.
Wir sind für Dich da, wenn Du aufgrund körperlicher Einschränkungen Unterstützung während des Bewerbungsprozesses brauchst.
Bewerbungsfotos sind bei uns nicht erforderlich.

intro:
Job Title:

Consultant, BI
description:
Job Description

As a consultant, you will play a key role in delivering enterprise-level reporting, dashboard solutions, and actionable insights across corporate domains. You will lead BI projects , Mentor Others, collaborate with stakeholders, and serve as a subject matter expert in translating complex business needs into scalable Domo solutions.
This role is 100% remote from any country/region

Key Responsabilities : 
Lead the design and delivery of BI dashboards, KPI models, and end-to-end reporting solutions using Domo and other BI platforms.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications with strong data modeling and storytelling capabilities.
Serve as the primary POC for Corporate stakeholders, providing advisory support and guiding on data strategy.
Mentor junior BI team members and ensure adherence to development standards and governance protocols.
Collaborate with data engineers and domain experts to ensure data quality, integrity, and alignment with business definitions.
Manage intake of new requests, prioritize based on business impact, and communicate delivery timelines clearly.
Drive UAT processes and support stakeholders in interpreting insights and identifying business opportunities.
Required qualifications: 
Expert in Domo with end-to-end dashboard development experience.
3+ years of experience in BI, data analytics, or corporate reporting roles.
Strong grasp of data modeling, ETL workflows, and KPI frameworks.
Excellent communication skills, especially in explaining complex data to non-technical audiences.

description:
Job Description :
A Business Analyst is a link between the IT department and the company, as well as with external customers and suppliers. The objective of the role is to implement and maintain an application solution around the ERP system and its ecosystem. The person will join our Da Vinci team which focuses on the implementation and configuration of new ERP and CRM systems - Microsoft Dynamics AX and Salesforce in Arrow's EMEA region.
 
Establish and maintain continuous assessment of operational processes in the EMEA region, Perform ongoing analysis of business needs to optimize business processes. You will be responsible for setting up and monitoring the continuous evaluation of business processes in the EMEA region, the ongoing analysis of business needs in order to optimize them, Act as a single point of contact for the business community regarding functional requirements, Manage the review and validation of functional specification documents, Manage user acceptance tests of the solutions provided, Monitor the entire process and think about continuous improvement, analyze reports and ROI metrics, Provide on-site support for end-to-end testing during ERP implementation.
 
The profile we are looking for:


3 years of experience in the field
Knowledge of MS AX Dynamics / MS Dynamics Navision required


Knowledge of Salesforce will be a plus
Fluent English, French will be an asset Excellent communication and analytical skills
Supply Chain experience


EDI (Electronic Data Interchange) and/or APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) knowledge

description:
Job Description

Technical expert that will drive late-stage process development activities of novel antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs).  Independently identify, develop, and execute laboratory experiments to address critical project needs.  Continuously seek to improve existing laboratory methods and processes.  Read and adapt literature to accomplish assignments.  Demonstrate mastery of a broad range of experimental techniques and methods of data analysis.  Collaborate effectively with cross-functional groups ensure robust process scale-up and tech transfer to manufacturing sites.

Responsibilities:

List up to 10 main responsibilities for the job. Include information about the accountability and scope.

•Independently design and conduct critical experiments that further project goals.

•Implement and may innovate new experimental protocols/techniques.

•Understand the goal and maintain a high proficiency in his/her projects as well as the overall

program.

•Interpret results and draw conclusions from own multistage experiments, note significant

deviations, then suggest, design, and pursue relevant experiments.

•Understand relevant scientific literature and apply theoretical framework to solving problems within

scientific discipline in a timely manner.

•Perform routine and complex tasks competently and independently and generate reliable and

consistent results.

•Impact projects mostly through lab and/or pilot plant based activities.

•Responsible for compliance with all applicable Corporate and Divisional policies and procedures.

•Understand and adhere to corporate standards regarding code of conduct, safety, appropriate

handling of materials, controlled drug and radioactive compounds, GxP compliance, and animal care

where applicable.


Qualifications

•Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent education with typically 5 years of experience, or Master’s Degree

or equivalent education with typically two years of experience.

•Theoretical and practical knowledge to carry out the job functions.


Additional Information

Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law:

This range may be modified in the future.

description:
Job Description

Key Responsibilities

Manage antibody production campaigns in collaboration w/therapeutic areas, incl. data mgmt, presentation & coordination of assays to be run.
Execute high throughput molecular cloning & antibody production workflows using automation technologies.
Lead dvlpmt of new automated liquid handling or analytical workflows.
Characterize therapeutic proteins using MS, SEC, DSF, ELISA, SDS-PAGE, FACS.

Qualifications

Education & Experience

Must have a Master's in biology, biochemistry or related field & 2 yr research or industry exp in:

(i) Applying molecular biology techniques (PCR, molecular cloning);

(ii) Utilizing sequence analysis tools (Vector NTI, Geneious, Sequencher), graphing software (GraphPad Prism) &statistical analysis (Python);

(iii) Applying cell culture (bacteria, mammalian) & protein purification techniques (AKTA, Protein Maker, Assay MAP);

(iv) Conducting analytical characterization of therapeutic proteins (MS, SEC, DSF, ELISA, SDS-PAGE); and

(v) Conducting statistical (Python) and structure-based (PyMol, Schrodinger Bioluminate) analysis of protein structure and function to predict liabilities and features of interest in antibodies.

Of experience required, must also have 1 yr research or industry exp utilizing and developing methods on liquid handling platforms (Hamilton, Tecan, Dynamic Devices).

Experience may be gained concurrently.


Additional Information

Salary Range: $104,200 - $138,500 per year.

Apply online at https://careers.abbvie.com/en. Refer to Req ID: REF39458D. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.  This job is eligible to participate in our short-term and long-term incentive programs.

intro:
## Location
Morocco
## Location Type
Remote
Who we are is what we do.


Deel is the all-in-one payroll and HR platform for global teams. Our vision is to unlock global opportunity for every person, team, and business. Built for the way the world works today, Deel combines HRIS, payroll, compliance, benefits, performance, and equipment management into one seamless platform. With AI-powered tools and a fully owned payroll infrastructure, Deel supports every worker type in 100+ countries—helping businesses scale smarter, faster, and more compliantly.
Among the largest globally distributed companies in the world, our team of 5,000 spans more than 100 countries, speaks 74 languages, and brings a connected and dynamic culture that drives continuous learning and innovation for our customers.
As the fastest-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world-class companies – breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software; we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. In 2024 alone, we paid $11.2 billion to workers in nearly 100 currencies and provided healthcare and benefits to workers in 109 countries—ensuring people get paid and protected, no matter where they are.
Our momentum is reflected in our achievements and customer satisfaction: CNBC Disruptor 50,  Forbes Cloud 100, Deloitte Fast 500, and repeated recognition on Y Combinator’s top companies list – all while maintaining a 4.83 average rating from 15,000 reviews across G2, Trustpilot, Captera, Apple and Google.
Your experience at Deel will be a career accelerator. At the forefront of the global work revolution, you'll tackle complex challenges that impact millions of people's working lives. With our momentum—backed by a $12 billion valuation and $800  million in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years—you'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought-after leader in the transformation of global work.
Responsibilities:


We are looking for a proactive Junior Finance Analyst with a strong data orientation to contribute to our financial analysis and reporting processes. Your responsibilities will encompass:
Data-Driven Insights: Extracting actionable insights from extensive and intricate data sets, enabling informed decision-making. Workflow Development: Creating efficient data processing workflows to enhance our reporting capabilities and streamline data accessibility. Data Structuring for Efficiency: Assisting in structuring data to optimize the efficiency of extracting pertinent business information. Data Auditing and Resolution: Auditing data to identify and resolve potential data quality issues, collaborating closely with the Data team to ensure swift resolution. Proactive Reporting: Proactively providing actionable reports to business stakeholders based on data analysis, aiding in strategic decision-making. Analytical Problem-Solving: Conducting thorough analytical deep-dives to analyze and resolve complex financial problems effectively. Financial Modeling: Assisting in the creation of financial models to forecast relevant KPIs for the Finance department, contributing to strategic planning.
competences:
Skills:


To succeed in this role, you should possess the following skills and qualifications:
SQL Proficiency: Fluent in SQL for efficient data querying and manipulation. Excel and Analytical Skills: Excellent command of Excel and strong analytical capabilities for data interpretation. Data Analysis Experience: Minimum of 2 years in a similar data analysis function. Financial Acumen: Solid understanding of P&L and Cash-Flow concepts. Project Management in a Fast-Paced Environment: Experience handling multiple priorities and projects within a dynamic setting. Proactivity and Autonomy: Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects independently, knowing when to escalate issues or seek support. Communication and Data Presentation: Strong communication skills with the ability to present data effectively to various stakeholders. Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail and a willingness to delve into analytical investigations. Educational Background: Preferred, minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
This role presents an exciting opportunity for a budding finance professional with a strong inclination towards data-driven analysis and reporting.
Note: This job description outlines the general nature of work and is not exhaustive in listing all responsibilities, duties, and required skills.

intro:

APM Terminals
APM Terminals play an important role in enabling the global Maersk Ocean and Logistics network as well as serving other Shipping Lines, Beneficial Cargo Owners, Freight Forwarders, intermodal logistics providers and integrating with a wide variety of local port authorities, customs and government bodies across our global network of transshipment, import and export gateway terminals.
In support of the broader Maersk strategy, we are accelerating the transformation of our business from a portfolio of independently operated terminals into a safer, better, bigger global terminals operator
We Offer
This is an exciting career opportunity in an international, challenging business setting known for diversity and high-paced environment. You will get to focus on creating valuable relations with current and new customers and work with highly professional teams in an environment where you will be valued, recognized, and well rewarded.
Purpose:
· Ensure reporting of monthly financial performance is reviewed and validated before submission. 
· Ensure Rolling Forecasts are reported timely and correctly, and are based on well-founded and well documented assumptions, and clear targets are defined for main operational KPI’s. 
· Own and drive the terminals performance management process, thereby challenging and influencing decision makers through relevant and timely performance discussions. · Provide meaningful and relevant data-based insights into terminal performance to enable strategic and operational decision making. 
· Drive future business decisions by building and implementing models for decision making. 
· Act as business partner for other functions at the terminal, especially Operations and Asset Management, to create better understanding of link between operational and financial performance. 
· Ensure main drivers for achieving financial and non-financial targets are well understood by all relevant stakeholders and relevant actions are identified and followed up on in case of under- performance. 
· Support wider organization with the resolution of open audit observations.
Key responsibilities:
Financial Planning and Analysis:
· Define and coordinate quarterly planning process, in line with instructions communicated by HQ, including alignment with Terminal COO, West Med MD, West Med CFO and other functional partners. 
· Ensure detailed plan is prepared, communicated, and executed safeguarding that deadlines and deliverables are met. Plan must ensure that draft forecast figures are presented to West Med MD and West Med CFO for approval well in advance of submission deadline, so potential revisions can be performed. 
· Coordinate alignment with other functions around link between underlying business drivers and financial performance. · Drive continuous improvement in forecast accuracy, both for Opex and Capex. 
· Estimate up- and downsides for presented forecasts. 
· Prepare and circulate standard Rolling Forecast presentation outlining assumptions made and financial performance for the relevant forecasting period. 
· Prepare presentations as requested by HQ for discussion and approval of prepared financials. 
· Coordinate identification of possible cost saving initiatives and the subsequent periodical follow-up on realization with relevant business owners. 
· Follow up with functions on deviations versus forecast and ensure understanding of underlying reasons and that corrective actions are taken by relevant business owners.
Capital Employment Management
· Lead investment decision process in line with latest communicated APMT investment policy. 
· Validate strategic fit of proposed investments, challenge business owners on necessity, timing, and scope. 
· Evaluate proposed investments and suggest alternatives like process optimization, discontinuation of activities, or lease. 
· Develop sound business understanding to challenge presented operational and financial assumptions. 
· Validate business case assumptions and perform risk analysis on those and translate that into an IRR and NPV range. 
· Challenge timing of investments considering internal approval process, licenses, front end loading, executability, and resources. 
· Develop necessary skills to use available standard valuation models and build supplementary ones, including high/low scenarios, and sensitivity analysis. Strategic Business Partnering · Be an active member of relevant business teams, meetings, and committees. 
· Sit with the business, be available, build relationships, take ownership and responsibility. · Improve short and long-term performance through relevant, accurate and timely reporting and analysis. Responsible for business intelligence and analytics to support decision making. 
· Understand different stakeholder needs and challenges, offer support with implementation of possible changes, and maintain an open mind for confronting ideas. · Work with Business Analyst team in GSC around support for the terminal for recurring reporting needs. 
· Participate in cross-functional teams, combining the understanding of the business with a financial perspective, with emphasis on value, risk, sustainability, and compliance. · Provide financial advice in projects and large tender processes, e. g. through clarification of commercial conditions and their impact on profitability, support in contract structuring etc. 
Efficient Finance Processes: 
· Support month end closing: o Close collaboration with ATR Team on ensuring correct accruals, by providing input for and approval of calculated amounts. o Review and validate monthly financial reporting figures before submission by AtR Team in OneStream, to confirm that presented figures are representative for the financial performance of the terminal. 
· Prepare high quality standard monthly reports:
financial management report. Capex update Functional cost reports TPR report · Ensure that process is defined and executed for quarterly review and update of terminal’s Enterprise Risk Management state. Coordinate the preparation of Board files for semi-annual Board Meetings.
We are looking for:
· Master’s degree in finance, Accounting or Business Economics. 
· 7+ years of experience with Financial Business Partnering or Controlling. 
· Strong analytical skills 
· Strong communications (in English), advising and influencing skills. 
· Excellent skills of BI tools, MS Office and especially Excel 
· Inquisitive, pro-active, builds relationships quickly. 
· Quality and detail oriented. 
· Driven to be ‘best in class’.

companie: Pfizer Inc
intro:
ROLE SUMMARY


The MSL, as a customer facing colleague, will have 90% of their time in the Field covering all Moroccan territory. Serve as a conduit and resource for Medical Information and customer insights, providing requested information to Health Care professionals (HCPs) as allowed by Pfizer guidance and sharing customer viewpoints with Pfizer as appropriate. Maintain required level of knowledge of relevant Therapeutic Area (TA)/disease states and Pfizer medicines, providing therapeutic area/product information to both internal and external stakeholders as needed Execute Medical strategy and engagement for appropriate assigned customers compliantly coordinating with other Pfizer colleagues as needed to achieve Medical objectives Deliver approved medical content about Pfizer medicines and relevant topics in the designated therapeutic area focusing on the relevant stakeholders and customers.
 
ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES


Understand the priorities of Pfizer Medical Affairs in the respective TA in order to contribute to execute aligned Field Medical tactics Provide education on the clinical impact of Pfizer medicines to help inform customer decision-making and improve patient outcome through the communication of real-world data analyses, and medical presentations. Provide objective and scientifically sound medical information regarding Pfizer’s medicines and the diseases they prevent through educational programs and scientific collaboration. Identify and seek medical engagement from the assigned customers Share internally the insights from the customers, and identify opportunities for collaboration to improve patient care Execute mutually beneficial customer-specific projects, collaborations, strategic medical partnerships, and non-interventional studies with the goal of advancing quality of care and improving patient outcomes Maintain significant market and customer knowledge in an increasingly complex and dynamic marketplace Manage a significant volume of projects developed in a field-based environment, while exhibiting the ability to prioritize, successfully implement, and demonstrate excellent judgment skills. Demonstrate expertise in communication across multiple channels, including, but not limited to, live and virtual presentations in small or large settings, written communication or virtual conversations Optimize patient centricity of Medical communications and deliverables, to ensure that patients remain the ultimate focus Appropriately provide Medical support throughout the Investigator Sponsored Research (ISR) process Cultivate research and therapeutic area expertise, including familiarity with latest congress data and disease state literature To develop and maintain ongoing cross-functional working relationships with Pfizer colleagues within the in-country, above-country and global organization
 
REQUIREMENTS


University degree in Medicine or Pharmacy 1-3 years experience in pharmaceutical Industry (Medical, commercial.) Prior experience in a respective Therapeutic Area is preferred Awareness of pharmaceutical industry codes, policies, local regulations. Possess strong analytical, self-awareness, and interpersonal skills Demonstrate excellent interpersonal skills: ability to manage and handle conflict constructively Strong comprehension and communication skills, including ability to communicate large amounts of scientific information in a manner that is clear and concise Demonstrate a strong patient-centric, customer-focused approach with the utmost medical professionalism Demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills Demonstrate the ability to Work within a matrixed, multi-disciplinary team Well-organized with the ability to be flexible, prioritize multiple demands. Rapidly adopt and utilize new digital technology and other resources with medical customers and record medical interactions Effectively manage through and be part of the change in an ever-changing and evolving external health care environment
  
 

Work Location Assignment: On Premise
Pfizer is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.
Medical#LI-PFE
Pfizer careers are like no other. In our culture of individual ownership, we believe in our ability to improve future healthcare, and potential to transform millions of lives. We’re looking for new talent to join our global community, to unearth new innovative therapies that make the world a healthier place.

Mutual + Company pension

Pratique des systèmes RAG et des modèles d’Embedding.

companie: Nielsen Consumer LLC
intro:
Job Description
About this job

This role combines data analysis and client consultation from the start, with plenty of room for growth. You find the stories behind scatter plots and help clients answer their business issues. Your insights will influence decisions for some of today’s leading global companies.

Responsibilities

Managing a portfolio of NielsenIQ retail FMCG partners in Maghreb countries;
Become an expert and own the ways of working on the Discover platform to be able to direct clients as needed;
Analyze and interpret retail audit data with actionable presentations on different FMCG categories to answer clients' business issues;
Ensure a daily interface with clients for data delivery, analysis, and answer their different requests;
Ensure day-to-day relationship management with internal teams for the completion of projects (panel & ad hoc);
Communicate clearly, professionally, and in a timely manner with both internal and external stakeholders;
Maintain client satisfaction with every encounter. Through understanding client queries, managing internal resources, setting client expectations & committing to timelines;
Use internal tools and data sources.
A little about you

Curiosity drives your interest in what moves the market. You find potential in percentages. Managing time and deadlines comes naturally to you. You’re known for your impeccable organization. Connecting with clients matters to you, and that motivates you to sift through data from a new angle. You can identify the narratives behind numbers, and you’re always looking for what’s next.

Qualifications

At least a bachelor's degree, preferably in business, economics, mathematics, statistics, or equivalent
1-2 years of work experience preferably within consumer or trade marketing, analytics and insights or market research
Knowledge of the Consumer-Packaged Goods (CPG) industry
Excellent analytical skills
Good communication skills both written and verbal
Good interpersonal skills
Adaptable to changes in priority or tasks
Has interest and knowledge on consumer marketing, statistics, research techniques, and experimental designs
Proficient in Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint, and learning new software
An ability to work independently and in a team
Fluent in spoken and written English and Business French
Comfortable working in a digital-enabled environment

titre: chef de projet analyste alm en freelance ref. 006014
companie: Novancy Consulting
intro:
Pour le compte de notre client, nous recherchons un Chef de projet Analyste ALM en Freelance pour la mise en place de la solution cible ALM. 

Durée de mission: 3 mois renouvelables (La durée prévisionnelle du projet est de 12 mois)
lieux: Casablanca Maroc
Démarrage: ASAP
Missions

Mise en place de la solution cible ALM dans le cadre du projet d’autonomisation
La principale mission est le renforcement du dispositif métier pour assurer l’aboutissement dudit projet, à travers les éléments suivants :
L’analyse de l’existant
Expression et définition du besoin et des processus cibles
Définition des règles métiers de calcul des métriques ALM
Définition des règles de gestion fonctionnelles
Validation du cahier des charges fonctionnel
Déroulement de la recette bancaire et homologation des Métriques et des reporting règlementaires.
Assistance post-démarrage en vue de la stabilisation du dispositif
Assurer une coordination avec les équipes ALM, IT et l’éditeur de l’outil.
Assurer la mise en œuvre et l’amélioration des calculs des métriques ALM (risque de taux, liquidité et change)
Participer à l’amélioration des processus de chargement des données et à la réduction du risque opérationnel (refonte d’une base Access et de certains traitements hors outils)
Rédiger la documentation fonctionnelle et technique des évolutions mises en place
Accompagnement des équipes ALM dans la conduite du changement, formation sur le nouveau dispositif tant sur le plan fonctionnel que technique, passation et démocratisation des outils mis en place
La participation active dans le projet d’autonomisation pour mettre en place une solution ALM permettant :
De maintenir à minima le standing des livrables ALM actuels, palier aux limites soulevées sur l’outil existant sous son actuelle configuration et de répondre et suivre les évolutions réglementaires dictées par Bank Al-Maghrib.
De répondre aux exigences réglementaires locales, aux exigences du pilotage ALM interne, en respectant les délais de livraison du projet.

titre: developpeur flux de donnees informatica senior (h/f)
companie: SQLI
intro:
Description de l'entreprise
Notre mission depuis 30 ans ? Être présent au bon moment !

Notre expertise ? Accompagner nos clients à capter l’attention de l’utilisateur et transformer cette interaction furtive en une interaction mémorable. C’est dans cette optique que nous accompagnons les entreprises dans la mise en œuvre, et le pilotage de dispositifs digitaux pour une expérience utilisateur réinventée.

La juste interaction, c’est quoi ? C’est capter notre attention au bon moment, au bon endroit et la convertir en envie et en confiance. Un équilibre subtil entre le trop et le trop peu. Entre le trop tôt et le trop tard.

Devenez SQLien et faites partie de cette grande aventure au sein d’une société à taille humaine, mais avec de grandes ambitions. Nous sommes plus de 2200 talents sur plus de 13 pays et 3 continents.

Notre culture ?
Oser et créer.
description:
Description du poste
En tant que Développeur Flux Informatica, vous serez en charge de la conception, du développement, de l’intégration et du maintien des flux de données au sein de notre infrastructure Informatica. Vous interviendrez à toutes les étapes des projets liés à l’intégration de données, de l’analyse des besoins jusqu'à la mise en production.

Vos missions incluent :

Développement et maintenance des flux de données : Créer, optimiser et maintenir les flux de données (ETL) à l’aide de l’outil Informatica PowerCenter.

Analyse des besoins métiers : Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de flux de données et proposer des solutions adaptées.

Conception et architecture des flux : Rédiger les spécifications techniques et proposer des solutions efficaces et évolutives pour les flux de données.

Suivi des performances : Analyser les performances des flux de données et effectuer des optimisations pour garantir leur efficacité et leur fiabilité.

Tests et validation : Réaliser des tests unitaires et fonctionnels pour assurer la qualité des développements avant leur mise en production.

Support et maintenance : Fournir un support technique pour la résolution des incidents en production et assurer la maintenance corrective et évolutive des flux.

Documentation : Rédiger et maintenir à jour la documentation technique liée aux flux de données, aux processus d'intégration et aux interfaces.


Qualifications
Compétences requises :

Compétences techniques :

Maîtrise d’Informatica PowerCenter et/ou d’Informatica Cloud.

Bonne connaissance des bases de données SQL (Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL, etc.).

Connaissance en gestion de processus d'intégration de données et d’ETL.

Expérience dans l’optimisation des performances des flux de données.

Connaissance des outils de gestion de version (Git, SVN).

Bonne compréhension des concepts de gestion des erreurs et des logs dans les flux de données.

Compétence en scripting (Shell, Python, etc.) est un plus.

Compétences fonctionnelles :

Bonnes capacités d’analyse et de compréhension des besoins métiers.

Autonomie dans la gestion des projets et des priorités.

Bonne communication écrite et orale, capacité à travailler en équipe.

Sens de la rigueur et de la qualité, souci du détail.

Profil recherché :

Diplôme en informatique ou équivalent (Bac +3/5).

Minimum de [X] années d’expérience dans le développement de flux de données avec Informatica.

Une expérience préalable dans un environnement similaire (gestion de données massives, Data Warehouse, Big Data, etc.) est un plus.

Capacité à travailler dans un environnement agile et à gérer plusieurs projets en parallèle.

Un bon niveau d’anglais est un atout.


Informations complémentaires
Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe ?

Un environnement dynamique et innovant, au sein d’une équipe passionnée par les technologies de données.
La possibilité de travailler sur des projets d’envergure, à la pointe des technologies cloud et Big Data.
Des opportunités d’évolution et de formation continue pour développer vos compétences.
Un cadre de travail flexible et des avantages attractifs.

titre: hr - senior associate career process optimization and insights - casablanca
companie: Infomineo
intro:
About us

Infomineo is a fast-growing business insights provider, bringing Brainshoring to global clients across a range of services: Business research, Content Services, Graphic Design, and Data Analytics. Our clients include leading Consultancies, Fortune 500 companies, Governments, and NGOs. Infomineo counts 350+ employees spread across 5 offices covering EMEA and the Americas (Casablanca, Cairo, Dubai, Barcelona and Mexico City). 

About this Role

In this role, the Senior Associate Career Process Optimization & Insights will be the go-to person for data analytics, process improvement, and project coordination—ensuring that high-value initiatives run smoothly. While you’ll collaborate on strategic topics, the final decisions and ownership remain at the senior leadership level. You will support the Director and senior team members in designing and executing programs related to career frameworks, succession planning, performance management, employee engagement, and internal mobility.

What will you do?

Process Improvement & Innovation

Contribute ideas for streamlining and digitizing existing career management processes (e.g., automating career committee, surveys, reducing manual data entry, etc.).
Partner with internal IT/Teach teams or external vendors to test and implement new performance management and HR tech features or integrations, under the guidance of senior team members.
Research and recommend best practices or emerging tools in talent management, ensuring Infomineo stays at the forefront of industry developments.
Analytics & Reporting

Gather, analyze, and interpret data on performance, succession, internal mobility, and engagement metrics.
Create user-friendly dashboards and reports (Excel, Power BI, etc.) for senior leadership review.
Collaborate with the Director to identify trends, potential gaps, or optimization opportunities in talent pipelines.
Proactively flag potential risks or resource constraints, offering recommendations to keep initiatives on track.
Project Coordination & Support

Develop project timelines, coordinate stakeholder meetings, and track milestones to ensure timely completion of deliverables.
Assist in planning and executing performance review cycles, career internal mobility initiatives, and high-potential programs.
Act as a central point of communication, disseminating project updates to relevant departments.
Employee Engagement & Communication

Liaise with department heads, and other teams to facilitate program rollouts (e.g., refresher sessions, sharing guidelines).
Prepare clear, concise communication materials and campaigns (e.g., email announcements, internal communication, FAQs sessions) to support program adoption and understanding. (Eg, career development initiatives, high potential programs, and internal mobility opportunities).
Collect feedback through surveys or focus groups from managers and employees, escalating any significant issues or recommendations to the Director.
Performance Management & Internal Mobility

Work closely with managers/PDCs and Heads to coordinate performance review cycles, calibrations, and career discussions.
Facilitate career internal mobility processes—posting roles internally, gathering applications, and supporting the selection and placement steps—while keeping accurate records.
Who you are?

Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business Administration, or a related discipline.
3–5 years of relevant project coordination, analytics or HR preferably in talent management, career development, or organizational development contexts.
Proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets (pivot tables, dashboards, data analysis).
Exposure to HRIS systems (e.g., Odoo) or talent management platforms
Familiarity with project management tools (e.g., Trello, Asana) is a plus.
Strong verbal and written English. French or Arabic proficiency is advantageous (depending on location/team mix).
Experience tailoring communication to multiple audiences (e.g., senior leaders, junior employees).
Key competencies:

Analytical & Data-Driven: Skilled at transforming data into actionable insights.
Project Management: Highly organized, able to prioritize multiple initiatives, and meet deadlines.
Process Improvement Mindset: Open to exploring new technologies; suggests digital or operational enhancements.
Collaboration & Communication: Comfortable working with stakeholders at all levels; excels at concise messaging and presentations.
Adaptability & Continuous Learning: Thrives in a dynamic environment; seeks feedback to grow professionally.
What we offer

A competitive salary
A great working environment & fast-track career trajectory
A healthy work-life balance
Health insurance Benefits
What is it like to work at Infomineo?

If you've spoken with someone who works at Infomineo, you've probably heard that our people are our most valuable asset. Our diversity, both in terms of professional experience and culture, is the company’s greatest strength.

As a Senior Associate in Career Process Optimization & Insights, you’ll be part of a collaborative, international HR team focused on innovation and impact. You'll contribute to initiatives around career development, performance management, and employee engagement, while learning best practices in process optimization and HR analytics. Your ideas will help streamline processes and shape meaningful talent programs, playing a key role in enhancing the employee experience and supporting Infomineo’s growth.

Equal opportunity employer

Infomineo is an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any sort of discrimination (based on color, race, sex, sexual orientation, religion, national origin or any other attributes) in all aspects of employment (recruiting, hiring, wages and salary, promotions, benefits, trainings and job termination).

If you believe you match our requirements and values, we would be happy to hear from you. Visit our website to know more about us, our services and company culture.

intro:

Définition les règles de gestion de la FPV :
•    Formaliser la description métier du référentiel de structure analytique avec l’aide des Business Data Owner. 
•    Maintenir la documentation de référence et s’assurer de la mise en place des règles de gestion dans les outils. 
•    Communiquer les informations aux utilisateurs et assurer des actions de formations.
Supervision de la qualité du référentiel : 
•    Réaliser / superviser les contrôles qualité sur les données et les règles de gestion du référentiel 
•    Mener des actions pour la sécurisation des données et animations de comités de supervision 
•    Garantir la cohérence entre la description métier et la description applicative des données en menant la campagne de revue d’utilisation de la FPV par les systèmes
Business Data Designer : 
•    Guider les projets et demandes d’évolution dans le respect des normes et standards s’appliquant au référentiel FPV 
•    En charge de la conduite du changement sur les évolutions du référentiel (normes et standards), challenge des demandes et formalisation de la description des données business (rédaction des expressions de besoin et validation en participant aux tests utilisateurs).
Support opérationnel de l’équipe de gestion des données de la FPV (FPV data Manager) : 
•    Co-supervision de la maintenance et des évolutions de l’outil de gestion de la FPV (Starware) 
•    Collaboration pour la gestion de la qualité des données et des processus de production dans le respect des règles de gestion.
Répondre aux sollicitations des auditeurs, inspecteurs (internes/externes) et autorités réglementaires (BCE/FED…).
En tant que membre de l’équipe Data Owner FPV, vous participerez aux différentes missions très variées du rôle de Data Owner dans un environnement transversal et riche qui vous permettra d’étendre vos connaissances métier et développer vos compétences en gestion de la qualité et gestion projet. Vous : 
•    Participez à la définition de la roadmap annuelle de l’équipe et prenez en charge une partie des tâches. 
•    Participez à l’élaboration, la maintenance et la diffusion des règles de gestion de la FPV 
•    Participez à l’animation de la communauté des différents Business Data Owner de la FPV qui comprend des membres du front office, de RISQ et de DFIN 
•    Participez à l’analyse et la promotion de la qualité des données (réalisation de dashboard, comités de remédiation, études sur les données/process…) 
•    Assurez des actions de formation et de documentation (e-learning, formation interne, à la carte, documents de référence FPV, maintenance du site Jive, Chatbot,  ..) 
•    Participez ou menez des projets utilisant la FPV ou d’évolution de la FPV 
•    Participez ou menez des actions de contrôle et sécurisation des données de la FPV et de leur utilisation 
•    Contribuez aux réponses aux sollicitations et aux recommandations des auditeurs et inspecteurs 
•    Participez ou menez des études et missions sur la FPV mandatées par les différents partenaires (DFIN, OPER, RISK et autres).
•    Vous êtes titulaire d’un diplôme Bac+4/5, de type école de commerce, d’ingénieur ou université avec une spécialisation en Finance de Marché et une expérience préalable en banque est souhaitable.
•    Votre niveau d’anglais est courant et vous avez une très bonne connaissance d’Excel. 
•    Votre rigueur, esprit d’analyse et de synthèse permettront de mener à bien les missions confiées.
Créée en 2014, SG ATS est une filiale du Groupe Société Générale qui fournit des solutions agiles et efficaces aux salles des marchés SG en Europe (principalement à Paris et Londres) afin de les aider à se développer et à répondre aux exigences de plus en plus fortes imposées par les différentes législations bancaires internationales. 
Forte de son succès, SG ATS fournit aujourd'hui des prestations à forte valeur ajoutée à différentes lignes de métiers du Groupe (en Europe principalement mais également aux Etats-Unis et en Asie) sur des activités de marchés, mais également à plusieurs directions du Groupe Société Générale.
Sacrée « Meilleur Employeur 2023 – Maroc » SG ATS est une structure jeune, dynamique qui positionne le capital humain au centre de son développement. SG ATS souhaite donc s’entourer de talents qui participeront activement à la réussite de l’entreprise tout en évoluant dans un environnement international propice au développement de compétences à forte valeur ajoutée. Vous serez basé à Casablanca au sein de la filiale SG Africa Technologies & Services (SGT ATS). 
Au sein de la filiale SG Africa Technologies & Services (SG ATS), vous rejoindrez la Direction Financière (DFIN), opérant pour les activités de Marchés (MARK) sur les normes du référentiel (NOR) : DFIN/MAR/ NOR.
L’équipe Data Owner de la FPV est le partenaire privilégié des experts métiers (Business Data Owner), de l’équipe de gestion des données et du workflow de validation de la structure analytique (SA), et de l’équipe informatique en charge de la SA.
Le secteur bancaire est en perpétuelle mutation, vous évoluerez donc au cœur d’une activité en pleine évolution dans son organisation, ses modes de fonctionnement et dans ses actions de communications

Job Description

We’re Concentrix, the global tech and services powerhouse helping the world’s top brands simplify, modernize, and transform how they connect with people. We’re intelligence-fueled and tech-powered — and we’re looking for a Salesforce Business Analyst to join our team in Rabat.

In this role, you’ll bridge the gap between business needs and smart technology solutions. You’ll analyze, optimize, and design Salesforce features that boost performance, drive adoption, and fuel digital transformation.

Career growth and personal development

At Concentrix, we invest in our people because when you thrive, our clients and customers thrive. You’ll have access to specialized training, industry certifications, and growth programs designed to support your career journey, every step of the way.

In fact, most of our managers and leaders have been promoted from within.

What you will do in this role

As a Salesforce Business Analyst, you will:

Collaborate with business stakeholders to analyze, define, and document Salesforce-related requirements.
Translate business needs into scalable Salesforce solutions, ensuring alignment with industry best practices.
Work with developers and administrators to customize and optimize Salesforce functionalities (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, etc.).
Support CRM implementation projects, system integrations, and data migration.
Develop and maintain detailed process flows, wireframes, and functional documentation.

Le titulaire du poste rejoindra la cellule « accès marchés » au sein de l’équipe EDO (Electronic Orders & Data Oversight) du pôle MARK/BTO/ORM. L'objectif de cette cellule est d’assurer l’enregistrement & le suivi de tous les accès des traders & sales de la banque d’investissement aux différentes bourses internationales.
Vous serez amené à travailler en étroite collaboration avec tous les acteurs de la banque d’investissement à savoir, les traders, les vendeurs, les ingénieurs etc.
Vous serez en charge des tâches suivantes :
Participation aux différents projets en tant que sponsor, coordinateur ou contributeur MARK (projets de remédiation, recommandations d’audits, etc…) Mise en place / adaptation de la gouvernance MARK autour des accès marchés Exécution et coordination des contrôles liés aux accès marchés Réalisation et coordination de la production des reportings adéquats Interagir en bonne intelligence avec les différentes fonctions de support ou de contrôle de la banque, en s’assurant d’un bon alignement des priorités et d’une coopération fructueuse. Veille technologique et réglementaire
La capacité à initier ou implémenter des améliorations de processus (contrôles, automatisation, simplification, homogénéisation, augmentation de la qualité et organisation de comités) est un facteur clé de succès
De formation Ecole d'ingénieur / Ecole de commerce / Master en ingénierie financière
Vous disposez d'une expérience de 5 ans minimum en analyse de risque / gestion de projet en lien avec la finance de marchés et des réglementations en vigueur (notamment MIFID, EMIR…) dans un environnement finance de marché.
Curiosité, Rigueur, capacité d'adaptation à un environnement en évolution constante, une bonne communication, une faculté à anticiper les risques et faire preuve de proactivité, sont des qualités nécessaires à la réussite dans ce poste.
Créée en 2014, SG ATS est une filiale du Groupe Société Générale qui fournit des solutions agiles et efficaces aux salles des marchés SG en Europe (principalement à Paris et Londres) afin de les aider à se développer et à répondre aux exigences de plus en plus fortes imposées par les différentes législations bancaires internationales. 
Forte de son succès, SG ATS ambitionne de devenir un centre multi-services, toujours en fournissant des prestations à forte valeur ajoutée à différentes lignes de métiers du Groupe sur des activités de marchés, mais également à la direction des risques, la direction financière, la direction de la conformité et à d’autres directions centrales. 
Sacrée « Meilleur Employeur 2023 – Maroc » SG ATS est une structure jeune, dynamique qui positionne le capital humain au centre de son développement. SG ATS souhaite donc s’entourer de talents qui participeront activement à la réussite de l’entreprise tout en évoluant dans un environnement international propice au développement de compétences à forte valeur ajoutée.

# Job Summary
The AI Automation Specialist (IT Support) is responsible for analyzing operational workflows, and service delivery processes within IT Support and Managed Services. This role identifies opportunities for automation, workflow improvements, and knowledge management enhancements. The analyst collaborates with cross-functional teams to propose, present, and support the implementation of these initiatives, including leveraging AI-driven solutions and automation tools to enhance service efficiency.
# Key Responsibilities
Automation & AI Implementation


Identify and prioritize use cases for automation in IT support and managed services. Collaborate with customer engagement and technical teams to design, implement, and test automation solutions (e.g., chatbots, RPA, AI-assisted ticketing). Support the training and fine-tuning of generative AI models for knowledge base enhancement and service optimization.
Knowledge Management & Workflow Enhancement


Coordinate the establishment and continuous improvement of knowledge bases to enable self-service and improve resolution times. Work with subject matter experts (SMEs) to document best practices, troubleshooting guides, and FAQs. Ensure integration of knowledge management systems with automation and AI tools.
Cross-Team Collaboration & Change Management


Work with IT, service delivery, and business stakeholders to align automation initiatives with business goals. Facilitate training sessions and workshops to drive adoption of automation tools and new processes. Monitor industry trends and emerging technologies to identify opportunities for continuous improvement.
# Required Qualifications & Skills
Education & Experience


Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business Process Management, or a related field (or equivalent experience). 3+ years of experience in service operations, IT support, automation, or process improvement roles. Experience with IT Service Management (ITSM) tools such as ServiceNow, Zendesk, or Jira Service Management.
Technical & Analytical Skills


Strong understanding of workflow automation, AI-driven support tools, and process optimization methodologies. Familiarity with automation tools such as Robotic Process Automation (RPA), chatbot platforms, or AI-driven service solutions. Ability to analyze and interpret data to drive process improvement recommendations.
Soft Skills & Collaboration


Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Problem-solving mindset with a focus on efficiency and user experience. Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with AI/ML applications in customer support or managed services. ITIL certification or experience in IT Service Management frameworks. Knowledge of scripting languages or low-code automation platforms (e.g., Python, Power Automate, UiPath).

# Consultant.e Freelance Cybersécurité, Vulnérabilités, & Gestion de Programme (REF05)
#
Contexte de la mission


Dans le cadre d’un programme de cybersécurité stratégique, nous recherchons un.e consultant.e freelance pour assurer la gestion opérationnelle du programme "Vulnerability Management & Patching Management", ainsi que la production de reporting consolidé pour le compte d'une banque internationale, basée à Casablanca.
La mission vise à piloter le programme de gestion des vulnérabilités et du patching, à coordonner les actions de détection et de remédiation, et à consolider les données de suivi dans une dynamique d'amélioration continue de la posture de sécurité.
##
description:
Description des missions principales


### 🔍 Pilotage du programme cybersécurité
Gestion globale du chantier "Vulnerability Management" et "Patching Management". Coordination du patching de sécurité des serveurs, bases de données, équipements réseau et applicatifs. Suivi de la clôture du programme en cours, avec intégration des mises à jour nécessaires à la maîtrise du risque.
### 🔍 Gestion des vulnérabilités
Pilotage de la détection, de la centralisation et du suivi des vulnérabilités, incluant :
+ Vulnérabilités externes : exposition Internet, scans d'URLs externes.
+ Vulnérabilités internes : infrastructure interne, scans d'URLs internes.
+ Vulnérabilités du code source : scans de code applicatif.
+ Composition logicielle : analyse des librairies et composants open source.
+ Vulnérabilités applicatives : applications métiers, CMS, etc.
Coordination des campagnes de pentests à la demande, en fonction des besoins projets ou applicatifs spécifiques. Suivi rigoureux de la remédiation des vulnérabilités détectées.
### 🔍 Gouvernance et animation
Animation des comités de suivi auprès du top management, avec reporting régulier sur l’état d’avancement, la surface d’exposition et les plans d’action de remédiation.
### 🔍 Centralisation et Reporting
Consolidation des données issues des différents outils de détection et de suivi. Production de reportings consolidés et de dashboards via Power BI. Modélisation des données pour homogénéiser les formats de reporting et faciliter la lecture et l’analyse.
##
Compétences requises


### 🎯 Compétences fonctionnelles & gestion de projet
Expérience confirmée en gestion de projet / gestion de programme cyber. Autonomie forte dans la gestion de programmes complexes. Aisance dans l’animation de comités de pilotage avec des interlocuteurs de direction.
### 🎯 Compétences cybersécurité
Bonne connaissance des processus de gestion des vulnérabilités, de la détection à la remédiation. Expérience dans le pilotage de patch management. Coordination de campagnes de tests d'intrusion et suivi des actions correctives.
### 🎯 Compétences data & reporting
Maîtrise de Power BI pour le reporting consolidé. Expérience en modélisation et consolidation de données multisource. Capacité à structurer et harmoniser des reportings issus de divers outils de détection.
##
Modalités


📍 Localisation : Casablanca (présence sur site requise) 📅 Démarrage : ASAP 💼 Statut : Freelance 💰 Rémunération : Selon profil et expérience
## Mindset et culture de nos missions
Nous tenons à intégrer les meilleurs talents au sein des projets que nous gérons auprès de nos clients. Nos processus de sélection sont très rigoureux dans ce sens. Ceci dit, nous nous n’arrêtons pas à la cohérence compétences - mission, mais nous allons vers le mindset-fit et le cultural-fit. En effet, la cohérence entre la personnalité, les aspirations et les valeurs de chacun de nos consultants et de nos collaborateurs avec le contexte de chaque projet est un principe fondamental de notre philosophie de coopération.
Casablanca
# Consultant.e Freelance Cybersécurité, Vulnérabilités, & Gestion de Programme (REF05)
# Politique de confidentialité pour la marque employeur et le recrutement de Trusted Advisors
Date de publication : 07-06-2024
Nous gérons chez Trusted Advisors notre marque employeur ainsi que notre processus de recrutement par le biais de notre (le « Site Carrière »), ainsi qu’avec l’aide d’un système de suivi des candidats.
Dans la présente Politique de confidentialité, nous expliquons comment nous traitons vos données à caractère personnel dans les cas suivants :
La présente Politique de confidentialité décrit également les droits dont vous disposez lorsque nous traitons vos données à caractère personnel, ainsi que la manière dont vous pouvez exercer ces droits.
Lorsque nous utilisons le terme « Candidat » dans la présente Politique de confidentialité, nous faisons référence à chacun des Candidats connectés, Candidats postulants, Candidats sourcés et Candidats coopté, sauf indication contraire.
### 1. À propos du traitement des données à caractère personnel
Les données à caractère personnel désignent toutes les informations qui peuvent être directement ou indirectement liées à une personne physique vivante. Voici quelques exemples de données à caractère personnel : nom, adresse e-mail, numéro de téléphone et adresse IP. Par traitement de données à caractère personnel, il faut entendre toute utilisation automatisée de données à caractère personnel - telles que la collecte, la création, l'analyse, le partage et la suppression de données à caractère personnel.
Des lois et des réglementations régissent la manière dont les entreprises peuvent traiter les données à caractère personnel, appelées lois sur la protection des données. Différentes lois sur la protection des données s'appliquent à différents types d'utilisation de données à caractère personnel, et ce, dans différentes régions du monde. Un exemple important de loi sur la protection des données qui est pertinent pour notre utilisation de vos données personnelles, telle que décrite dans la présente Politique de confidentialité, est le Règlement Général sur la Protection des Données de l'Union européenne (2016/679, RGPD).
La plupart des obligations découlant du RGPD s'appliquent au responsable du traitement. Un responsable du traitement est l'entité qui décide à quelles fins les données à caractère personnel seront traitées et comment le traitement sera effectué. Le responsable du traitement peut faire appel à un sous-traitant de données. Un sous-traitant de données est une entité qui ne peut traiter les données à caractère personnel que selon les instructions du responsable du traitement et ne peut pas utiliser les données à caractère personnel à ses propres fins.
Lorsque nous traitons vos données à caractère personnel, nous assumons le rôle de responsable du traitement tel que décrit dans la présente Politique de confidentialité.
##### Toutes les personnes
Informations sur l'appareil - Si vous visitez notre Site Carrière, nous recueillerons des données sur votre appareil, telles que l'adresse IP, le type et la version du navigateur, le comportement de la session, la source du trafic, la résolution de l'écran, la langue préférée, l'emplacement géographique, le système d'exploitation et les paramètres/l'utilisation de l'appareil. Données techniques et statistiques - Si vous visitez notre Site Carrière nous collecterons des données techniques et statistiques concernant votre utilisation du site, comme les informations sur les URL visitées et votre activité sur le site. Données de communication - Nous recueillerons et conserverons vos communications avec nous, y compris les informations fournies par vous lors de ces échanges. Cela peut inclure, par exemple, le contenu des e-mails, des enregistrements vidéo, des messages sur les réseaux sociaux, les informations que vous ajoutez à votre compte chez nous, les réponses à des enquêtes, etc. Coordonnées - Telles que votre nom, votre adresse e-mail, votre numéro de téléphone ainsi que votre adresse physique.

Arrow Enterprise Computing Solutions, a division of the Arrow Electronics Group (16,500 employees spread across 58 countries, turnover + $29 billion), provides IT professionals (service companies, publishers and integrators) with global technological solutions associated with offers of training and services, in 5 main segments: servers, storage and virtualization, networks and security, infrastructure software and Cloud solutions.

An Arrow BPM is a strategic leader responsible for optimizing an organization’s operations on a dedicated set of assignments. He/she identifies bottlenecks, streamline workflows, and drives growth by translating complex business needs into efficient processes. He/she meticulously examines existing processes to identify inefficiencies and opportunities for improvement. He/she creates detailed process maps and redesign workflows to enhance performance and achieve desired outcomes. Successfully implementing process changes requires adept leadership. BPM oversees organizational change initiatives, helps to develop communication plans, provide guidance for training, and support the Change management team to address resistance to ensure smooth transitions. He/she establishes key performance indicators (KPIs) and track process metrics to gauge the effectiveness of process improvements. BPM collects and analyzes data to identify trends, measure progress, and make data-driven decisions. PBM works closely with various departments to gather input from stakeholders and defines standardized metrics. This collaboration ensures that process improvements align with overall business goals.
Good mixture between technical & soft skills is required: Process Mapping and Modeling: Proficiency in tools like BPMN (Business Process Model and Notation), Microsoft Visio to visualize and design efficient processes. Data Analysis: Ability to analyze data using tools like Power BI, or Excel to identify trends and measure process performance. Lean and Six Sigma: Knowledge of Lean management and Six Sigma methodologies to reduce waste and improve process efficiency. Configure Price Quote (CPQ) & Salesforce applications knowledge. Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively convey process changes and collaborate with stakeholders in fluent English. Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to identify issues and develop innovative solutions. Leadership: Ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage change initiatives. Organizational Skills: Strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects and ensure timely completion. Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing business environments and requirements. Collaboration: Ability to work collaboratively with various departments to gather input and ensure process improvements align with business goals.
Full Permanent contract, Social advantage: CNSS, CIMR, Health insurance, Very good working atmosphere in a team of passionate collaborators, Work culture where you can make an impact, Working within an international organization, recognized worldwide in its sector

---
#### Job description
Nos missions portent sur tout ou partie du cycle d’un projet : cadrage, conception, intégration, recette, déploiement et conduite du changement.
Pour accompagner le développement d’Asterigo, nous recrutons un(e) Consultant(e) expérimenté(e) EPM.
Vos responsabilités et missions possibles, selon votre expérience :


Cadrer et concevoir des solutions autour de la Data/Analytics et de la gestion de la performance, sur un périmètre métier transverse (Finance, Supply Chain, RH, Sales) - Extended Planning & Analysis (xP&A) ;
Participer aux différentes phases de projets d’implémentation et d’administration de solutions analytiques (Datahub, ETL, Model Building, Reporting, Data Visualisation) ;
Conseiller et proposer les solutions optimales en fonction des contraintes du client (délai, budget, ergonomie, performance…) ;
Assurer la satisfaction de votre client et être force de proposition pour répondre à ses besoins ;
Piloter des projets, conduire le changement et assurer l’accompagnement des directions métier postdéploiement ;
Encadrer et faire progresser une équipe.
Votre projet professionnel


En rejoignant Asterigo, vous aurez l’opportunité de développer de nouvelles compétences, de travailler sur des missions variées et d’incarner nos valeurs : Excellence, Proximité & Intrapreneuriat.
Vous contribuerez à la révolution de la transformation digitale en participant à mettre la technologie au service de la performance financière et opérationnelle de nos clients.
Vous travaillerez dans une entreprise à taille humaine et conviviale, qui place le bien-être au travail au cœur de ses priorités et offre de nombreux avantages à ses collaborateurs. Une entreprise engagée dans une démarche RSE, désireuse de créer un impact positif sur l’environnement et sur la société.
#### Preferred experience
Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’une école d’ingénieur, école de commerce ou titulaire d’un Master spécialisé en mathématiques / informatique décisionnelle.
Vous êtes passionné(e) par le monde de la Data, Analytics, Analyse prédictive, Finance, Supply Chain.
Vous justifiez d’une expérience réussie de 3 ans minimum dans le domaine de la finance (contrôle de gestion, audit) et/ou du conseil en informatique.
Vous connaissez une ou plusieurs solutions EPM ou BI (Board, SAP, Power BI, IBM, Excel…) et vous avez déjà une expérience certifiante sur Anaplan.
Vous vous distinguez par votre curiosité intellectuelle, votre esprit analytique ainsi que votre aisance communicationnelle (orale et écrite).
Vous cherchez à vous inscrire dans la durée avec l’ambition d’élargir le champ de vos compétences et de gagner rapidement en responsabilité.
Vous maîtrisez l’anglais.
🚀 Asterigo est un cabinet de conseil créé en 2019 spécialisé dans le pilotage de la performance financière et opérationnelle. Nous sommes la première société de conseil en France spécialisée dans la mise en place des architectures de planification connectée (xP&A).
Nous accompagnons nos clients dans la transformation digitale de leur système d’information, en industrialisant leurs processus métiers, tout en adressant des périmètres transverses (Finance, Supply Chain, Marketing, Sales, RH).
Nous nous appuyons sur nos partenariats avec les technologies leader dans le domaine de l’EPM (Enterprise Performance Management), comme la solution Anaplan.

description:
Job Description & Summary

Rejoignez-nous !
La raison d'être de PwC est de renforcer la confiance au sein de la société et d’apporter des solutions aux enjeux stratégiques de ses clients.
PwC développe au Maroc des missions d’audit, d’expertise comptable et de conseil (stratégie, management, transactions, juridique & fiscal) créatrices de valeur pour ses clients, privilégiant des approches sectorielles.
Plus de 325 000 personnes dans 152 pays à travers le réseau PwC partagent idées, expertises et perspectives innovantes au bénéfice de la qualité de service pour leurs clients et partenaires.
Au Maroc, PwC compte plus de 300 collaborateurs.Rejoignez l’équipe Deals et accompagnez les plus grands investisseurs financiers et stratégiques dans la réalisation de leurs acquisitions ou cessions.
Le pôle Deals de PwC, constitué au Maroc d'environ 25 professionnels expérimentés, s’appuie sur un réseau mondial Deals actif dans 70 pays. Cette practice, qui réunit des expertises complémentaires (Transaction Services, Optimisation de financement et accompagnement dans un contexte "distressed", corporate finance, évaluation), nous permet ainsi de garantir la réussite des projets de nos clients.

Notre équipe intervient notamment auprès de nos clients et les accompagne pour répondre aux spécificités de leurs projets de croissance externe (due diligence acheteur), mais également dans le cadre de processus de cession d’une filiale ou d’une participation (due diligence vendeur, assistance vendeur), ou lors de projets de recherche de financement ou de M&A dans un contexte "distressed". Cette équipe vous permettra d’effectuer des missions variées, aussi bien sur des transactions au Maroc, que sur des deals transfrontaliers (en étroite collaboration notamment avec le bureau PwC de Paris).





Ce que vous pouvez attendre :
- Etre exposé (e) à des environnements internationaux et stimulants, et participer à des deals transfrontaliers

- Analyser les performances historiques et futures d’une cible et identifier les zones de risques associées

- Challenger les éléments de valorisation

- Collaborer avec une grande variété d’interlocuteurs : directeurs financiers, fonds d’investissement, avocats, banquiers d’affaires, consultants en stratégie, fiscalistes, etc.

- Accompagner vos clients dans leurs prises de décisions, en tant qu’ interlocuteur autonome sur vos sujets

- Encadrer les analystes plus juniors/ stagiaires pendant vos missions, les évaluer et les conseiller dans leurs évolutions de carrière

- Avoir une carrière stimulante avec des expériences techniques et humaines de qualité

Ce que nous attendons de vous :

· Vous êtes diplômé (e) d’une grande école de commerce ou d’ingénieur

· Vous vous êtes construit une expérience en finance d’entreprise pendant vos stages ou lors d’expériences précédentes (ex. audit, M&A, Private Equity, contrôle de gestion)

· Votre niveau d’anglais est impérativement courant, à l’écrit comme à l’oral

· Vous êtes curieux (se), rigoureux (se) et savez faire preuve d’agilité

· Vous alliez capacités analytiques, techniques, esprit de synthèse et sens business

· Vous avez le goût du travail en équipe et le sens du service client
