companie: Novancy Consulting
intro:
Description: 

The AI Financial Analyst focuses on assessing the financial impact and ROI of AI initiatives. They analyze the cost, revenue, and financial benefits of implementing AI solutions and help businesses understand the financial implications of their AI investments. They will also provide insights on funding, budgeting, and financial models for AI projects.

Mission: 3 months (renewable for the duration of the project).
Location: Rabat/Casablanca, Morocco.
Start Date: ASAP.
Language: Fluent English required (CVs must be submitted in English).
Work Mode: Hybrid (mix of on-site and remote work).
Key Responsibilities:

Develop financial models to assess the cost and potential returns on AI investments.
Conduct cost-benefit analysis for AI-driven projects and initiatives.
Provide insights into AI project pricing, budgeting, and funding options.
Evaluate financial risks associated with AI investments and develop mitigation strategies.
Work closely with the AI Strategy Expert and leadership to prioritize AI projects based on financial feasibility and value.
competences:
Skills Needed:

Financial Analysis: Strong skills in financial modeling, budgeting, and forecasting, with a focus on AI-related investments. Experience in ROI modeling for technology investments, particularly in AI and Data.
AI Cost-Benefit Analysis: Ability to assess the potential financial benefits and costs of AI solutions, including long-term ROI. Understanding of AI project cost structures, including cloud services, talent, and tools.
Data Analytics: Proficiency in data analysis tools (Excel, Python, R, Tableau, PowerBI,…) to assess financial data and AI project metrics.
Understanding of AI and Data Economics: Knowledge of how AI impacts operational costs, resource allocation, and overall business economics.
Risk Management: Ability to assess financial and operational risks related to AI investments.
Reporting and Presentation: Ability to present complex financial information clearly to both technical and business stakeholders, and to translate it into actionable insights.
Regulatory Compliance Knowledge: Understanding of financial regulations and compliance issues as they pertain to AI projects.

companie: JTI
intro:
At JTI we celebrate differences, and everyone truly belongs. 46,000 people from all over the world are continuously building their unique success story with us. 83% of employees feel happy working at JTI.

To make a difference with us, all you need to do is bring your human best.

What will your story be? Apply now!  

Learn more: jti.com

TOBACCO QUALITY ASSOCIATE

For the new tobacco factory in TETOUAN, we are seeking Quality Associate to monitor production processes, conduct quality inspections, and ensure compliance with safety protocols and JTI standards. This position is based on-site.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

As a Quality Associate, you will be responsible for ensuring the compliance of processes and final products through regular inspections, adhering to the Quality Inspection Plan. You will monitor and check compliance against product specifications, taking necessary corrective actions when requirements are not met.

You will maintain accurate quality inspection data by registering daily test results in the quality database or on hard-copy records as required. This includes calculating daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual averages for test results and preparing and submitting summary reports to your immediate supervisor.

You will inspect material handling and process flows, ensuring all operations follow established procedures. This also includes overseeing brand changeover procedures and demonstrating a strong commitment to health and safety standards.

You will participate in KPI calculations, organize summarized data, and support root cause identification for corrective actions. Additionally, you will be responsible for managing QUIP (Quality Unsure Inspected Products) by holding, segregating, labeling, and inspecting products identified during inspections, as per the established guidelines. You will also help identify the root cause and propose possible solutions for any issues.

You will ensure the proper use and handling of quality measuring instruments (QME), ensuring that equipment is safely utilized and the working area remains clean and organized. Your role will also involve actively participating in system upgrades, ensuring effective implementation, and coaching shop floor operators in adapting to new systems.

Additionally, you will support pest control activities, particularly in managing tobacco beetle, and participate in the implementation of 5S and 3R initiatives to standardize quality laboratories.

EDUCATION

University degree in Chemistry or similar.

WORK EXPERIENCE

2-3 years of work experience in a Manufacturing environment.
competences:
SKILLS

Proficiency in English, French, and Arabic (written and verbal communication)
Strong computer skills with advanced proficiency in MS Office Suite
In-depth knowledge of internal regulatory compliance and procedures
Expertise in safety protocols and maintaining a safe work environment
Solid laboratory skills with experience in quality control processes
Strong understanding of statistical analysis and data interpretation principles
Are you ready to join us? Build your success story at JTI. Apply now!

Next Steps:

After applying, if selected, please anticipate the following within 1-3 weeks of the job posting closure: Phone screening with Talent Advisor > Assessment tests > Interviews > Offer. Each step is eliminatory and may vary by role type.

intro:
Position:System AdministratorJob Description:
Arrow Enterprise Computing Solutions (ECS), a part of Arrow Electronics, brings innovative IT solutions to market to solve complex business challenges. We deliver value-added distribution, business consulting and channel enablement services to leading technology manufacturers and their channel partners. We help businesses grow faster, operate efficiently and transform in a dynamic market.  

Position Summary:


The System Administrator with Access Management Specialization plays a critical role in managing and maintaining the organization's IT infrastructure while ensuring secure and efficient user access to systems, applications, and data. This role is focused on access management processes, identity lifecycle management, and maintaining compliance with security policies.
Key Responsibilities:
System Administration:
1.    Infrastructure Management:
o    Maintain, upgrade, and troubleshoot servers, storage, and cloud environments (on-premises or cloud-based).
o    Perform software and hardware updates for systems, ensuring optimal functionality and security.
o    Monitor system health and performance, and ensure high availability and reliability.


2.    Security and Compliance:
o    Implement security policies and protocols across systems.
o    Conduct regular system audits and reviews to ensure compliance with regulatory and organizational standards.


3.    Backup and Recovery:
o    Develop and maintain backup strategies for critical data and systems.
o    Execute disaster recovery plans and troubleshoot system failures as needed.


Access Management:
1.    Identity and Access Lifecycle:
o    Manage user accounts, roles, and permissions for systems, applications, and databases.
o    Onboard/offboard users in accordance with organizational policies and procedures.
o    Facilitate provisioning and de-provisioning of system access.


2.    Authentication and Authorization:
o    Configure and maintain Single Sign-On (SSO), Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), and role-based access controls (RBAC).
o    Ensure secure access for internal and external users while minimizing risks.


3.    Access Policies:
o    Design and implement policies for access control (e.g., least privilege principles).
o    Regularly review and update access policies to align with evolving security requirements.


Incident Management:
1.    Investigate and respond to access-related security incidents.
2.    Resolve access issues promptly, minimizing disruption to users.


Collaboration and Support:
1.    Work closely with IT teams, security teams, and business stakeholders to address access requirements and optimize workflows.
2.    Provide end-user support for authentication and access-related issues.
3.    Deliver training and documentation for users on access protocols and systems.


Requirements:


Education:
•    Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).


Experience:
•    Proven experience in system administration roles.
•    Strong expertise in access management technologies (e.g., Active Directory, Azure AD, IAM systems).

Proficiency in server operating systems (e.g., Windows Server, Linux).
Knowledge of authentication protocols (e.g., LDAP, Kerberos, OAuth).
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).


2.    Analytical and Problem-Solving:
o    Ability to diagnose and resolve access-related issues quickly and efficiently.
o    Capability to analyze access data and identify potential risks.

intro:

## Health Economics Senior Consultant (Real-World Evidence)
locations
: Casablanca, Morocco
time type
: Full time
posted on
: Posted 30+ Days Ago
job requisition id
: R1444265
We are looking for driven candidates seeking to launch their career in Health Economics and join our regional team based in Casablanca, Morocco to help our clients improve their clinical, scientific and commercial results. You will work in a dynamic, global company of over 60,000 employees in more than 100 countries with a broad range of healthcare information, technology and service offerings.

Our clients operate in the life sciences industry, including the global top 20 pharmaceutical, medical device and biotech companies, as well as public health providers and regulatory authorities. They are looking for insight and evidence around the safety, efficacy, effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of health care delivery systems, medical devices, and pharmaceutical products spanning the full spectrum of therapeutic and disease areas. Our diverse mix of clients, the breadth of disease areas, as well as increasing access to novel data sources and methodologies provide a constant and rewarding challenge for our people.

For more information about our company please visit our website: https://www.iqvia.com/

Role purpose

You will work from our office in Casablanca and report into the Principal Real-World Services, with focus mainly on the Moroccan market and other markets in East, West and North Africa, supporting our regional Real World Services team based in Casablanca, Morocco. Typical projects include development and adaptation of medico-economic models, network meta-analyses, survival analysis and real-world evidence studies using electronic medical records, databases, registries and claims. The audience for these analyses will be various pharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical technology companies. As part of a broader team, you will contribute to the design of these type of studies, preparation of the data, analysis, quality control, interpretation and presentation of the results. Part of your role will be to develop proposals and provide clients with high quality and timely solutions to meet their needs.

Principal Accountabilities

1- Business development:


Lead the business development activities and build strong relationships with external stakeholders, including experts, clients, MoH, private and public institutions… Interact with internal and external stakeholders to identify Real world services projects. Assist with client management and attend external meetings.
2- Projects delivery:


Lead the development and adaptation of medico-economic models (cost-effectiveness, cost-utility and budget impact models), Organize and conduct high quality primary and secondary research studies Conduct evidence synthesis by means of meta-analysis, indirect treatment comparison or network meta-analysis (frequentist or Bayesian) with patient-level and/or aggregate data (e.g. from literature review) from RCTs Contribute to the development of value dossiers and support material for clients Conduct retrospective and prospective observational studies, including the development of study protocol, questionnaire, data analysis, study report and publications. Specify and/or extract data from databases; prepare and analyse datasets according to study protocol and SAP Lead the dissemination of any relevant findings through technical reports, manuscripts, posters and presentations, Assist with project management and project delivery, including oral presentations
Qualifications And Skills


MSc or PhD or equivalent in health economics, epidemiology, statistics, biostatistics or related discipline Prior relevant experience working, at least 8 years, as a pharmaco-economist, HEOR and/or Market Access in consultancy, CRO or pharmaceutical/biotech Ability to develop and adapt pharmaco-economics models (e.g. Markov models) Good understanding of the Moroccan healthcare system is a prerequisite Strong numeracy and quantitative skills as well as competency using MS Excel (competency using Visual Basic is a plus) Fluency in French and English (spoken and written) Strong written and verbal communication skills Flexible & problem-solving mindset, excellent attention to detail and ability to check own work so that drafts are delivered to a high quality Strong time-management and organizational skills Attitude to work well as a member of team and to build and manage relationships in a multi-cultural environment Eligibility to work in Morocco without visa sponsorship
IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com
IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide. Learn more at
IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create connections that accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments. Everything we do is part of a journey to improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide.
To get there, we seek out diverse talent with curious minds and a relentless commitment to innovation and impact. No matter your role, everyone at IQVIA contributes to our shared goal of helping customers improve the lives of patients everywhere. Thank you for your interest in growing your career with us.

companie: VISA
intro:
Company Description
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
description:
Job Description
The Regional Client Resolution team is responsible for providing production operational support to Clients and their line(s) of business, managing a wide range of moderate to complex problems of diverse scope, identifying opportunities to improve Client performance and Client experience along with the appropriate courses of action, and driving issues and opportunities through to completion.

Respond to operational, post-production support inquiries from Visa issuers, processors in CEMEA (Central Eastern Europe, Middle East Africa) region to ensure best client experience.
Provide information and direction for CEMEA clients regarding VisaNet Core Application Services, Billing, Visa Resolve Online, Clearing&Settlement, Visa Token Service, Visa Secure and other operational queries within scope.
Perform general transaction research to analyze potential technical or operational problems or issues.
Log service requests (cases) in a timely and accurate manner in accordance with defined internal processes and standards.
Follow the Client Resolution Case management guide and all stages of the case resolution process in line with defined SLAs and targets. Manage the cases assigned or escalated from the L1 support team efficiently.
Work with stakeholders within CS (Client Services) and non-CS organizations to resolve client issues.
Be accountable for delivering against commitments to clients.
Be organized in tasks and activities.
Keep accurate records in the defined CRM system.
Contribute to developing process improvement procedures to improve operational efficiency.
Contribute to the defined team operational metrics/targets execution.
This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager


Qualifications
Bachelors/Master's Degree
Experience in a customer-facing role in software, financial/banking or information services
Languages: English (Russian, French is beneficial)
Experience within card processing/ card technologies/account management/contact center/implementation project management within payments departments would be beneficial
Data analytical skills
Strong communication and business writing skills
Technical aptitude with the ability to absorb lots of technical information and strive for continuous constant learning
Understanding of basic authorization, clearing&settlement flows, knowledge of Visa products&services would be a significant benefit
Must be a self-starter with strong organization, time management, problem solving and resolution management skills
Customer focus with proven ability to establish productive working relationships with key internal stakeholders
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Excel, Tableau

Additional Information
Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

intro:
Description: 

The AI Implementation Expert is responsible for guiding the successful deployment of AI solutions from proof-of-concept to full-scale implementation. They work closely with all the stakeholders to ensure AI use cases are properly defined, built, and executed. Their role involves risk management, setting realistic timelines, and ensuring that technical and business objectives are met.

Mission: 3 months (renewable for the duration of the project).
Location: Rabat/Casablanca, Morocco.
Start Date: ASAP.
Language: Fluent English required (CVs must be submitted in English).
Work Mode: Hybrid (mix of on-site and remote work).
Key Responsibilities:

Lead the implementation of AI use cases, ensuring that the solutions meet business requirements.
Collaborate with business leaders to define AI project scope and success criteria.
Oversee AI project timelines, resource allocation, and risk management.
Work closely with the AI Solution Architect to ensure technical feasibility and integration.
Advise on best practices for AI model development, testing, deployment, and monitoring.
Ensure alignment between business goals and technical execution of AI solutions.
competences:
Skills Needed:

Extensive experience in the end-to-end implementation of AI solutions (e.g., machine learning models, NLP, predictive analytics). Ability to guide teams through AI solution lifecycle phases.
Project Management: Ability to manage AI projects from concept to deployment, ensuring they stay within scope, time, and budget.
Technical Proficiency in AI: Deep understanding of AI/ML models, data pipelines, and deployment techniques. In-depth knowledge of AI tools and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn) and cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP, Oracle) and their AI capabilities.
Solution Design: Expertise in designing scalable AI solutions that meet business needs.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Ability to work with data scientists, developers, business analysts, and other stakeholders to deliver AI projects.
Change Management: Ability to contribute to the initiatives related to the cultural and organizational changes that come with AI implementation.
Performance Monitoring: Ability to measure and monitor the performance of AI systems post-deployment, including KPIs and continuous improvement.

titre: auditeur junior des systemes d'information et analytics (h/f)
companie: Mazars
intro:
Description de l'entreprise
Forvis Mazars est un groupe international d'audit, de fiscalité et de conseil. Avec + de 40 000 collaborateurs présents dans une centaine de pays, nous faisons partie du Top 10 des cabinets mondiaux.

Nous faisons des métiers sérieux... sans se prendre au sérieux. Faire partie de nos équipes, c'est avant tout assumer sa singularité et oser partager ses idées, dans une ambiance de travail que nous vous invitons à découvrir. Si vous souhaitez construire votre propre parcours et que vous aimez entreprendre, vous êtes au bon endroit !
description:
Description du poste
Nous cherchons à renforcer nos équipes d’audit françaises en recrutant une équipe d’audit localisée à Casablanca.

Être auditeur chez Forvis Mazars, c’est une expérience unique et riche ! 

Notre état d’esprit ? Déployer une approche sur-mesure et innovante pour nos clients, et ce dans la bonne humeur ! 

Nos enjeux ? Comprendre les problématiques de nos clients et les intégrer dans un contexte de révolution digitale, d’intelligence artificielle et de profondes mutations qui impactent les fonctions financières et le métier d’auditeur. 

Chez Forvis Mazars, la transformation digitale a offert de nouvelles perspectives : réinventer l'Audit, métier historique de Forvis Mazars. L'équipe ISAA (Information System Audit & Analytics) a développé une approche qui intègre l'Audit du contrôle interne et des Systèmes d'Information. 

L'équipe comprend des experts sectoriels (banque, assurance, industrie, secteur public, services …), des personnes certifiées en termes de contrôle interne, gestion des risques IT et sur certaines technologies de marché (SAP, Oracle Applications, PowerBI, etc.). 

En tant que jeune auditeur vous intégrerez l’équipe ISAA (Information System Audit & Analytics) composée de collaborateurs qui conjuguent des expertises variées (gouvernance IT, data, ERP, finance, …) pour servir les missions d’audit et de conseil. 

Vous aurez l’opportunité d’acquérir rapidement une méthodologie d’audit orientée systèmes d’information qui vous offrira un rôle clé dans la mission d’audit de commissariat aux comptes. 

La diversité de nos clients et de nos missions vous fera participer à des problématiques à enjeux : 

Analyse de l’environnement et de la stratégie d’entreprise sur le volet système d’information
Revue du contrôle interne IT et évaluation des risques
Audit des états financiers sous l’angle informatique
Revue de migration de systèmes vers des grands ERP
Revue de processus Métier et IT
Outre votre participation à la certification des comptes, vous interviendrez également sur des missions d’audit contractuel et de revue de projets et de projets SOCR (Service Organizations Control Reporting) / audit selon la norme ISAE3402 ! 

L’équipe Audit & Analytics place l’innovation au cœur de sa stratégie et développe des approches Data Analytics et Process Mining. Ainsi, vous pourrez travailler sur des technologies de DataPrep ou de DataViz telles qu’Alteryx ou PowerBI. ou encore participer au développement de solutions Mazars. 

Le rôle de l’Auditeur implique un engagement et un devoir de confidentialité quant à la diffusion et au partage des informations manipulées en externe et en interne. 


Qualifications
Diplômé(e) d’un niveau bac+5 d’une grande école de commerce, d’ingénieurs ou d’université, vous souhaitez saisir l’opportunité de participer à un parcours d’envergure. Intéressé(e) par l’idée de devenir un auditeur « tout-terrain », vous êtes curieux(se), flexible et vous faites preuve d’une forte autonomie et de rigueur. Outre un sens aigu des relations humaines qui vous permettra d’être à l’écoute de nos clients et d’intégrer nos équipes, vous possédez des compétences dans l’audit et/ou les systèmes d’information. 

Et parce qu’elle contribue à matérialiser l’excellence de Forvis Mazars à la française, votre expression orale est aisée et votre expression écrite évidemment impeccable. 

Enfin, votre anglais et votre français vous permettent d’interagir à l’écrit comme l’oral avec les clients dans un contexte international. 

Si vous êtes passionné(e) par les données et souhaitez évoluer dans un environnement stimulant, n'hésitez pas à nous envoyer votre candidature !

Processus de recrutement

Charline Courty a la charge de ce recrutement, elle sera votre point de contact tout au long du processus. Une fois votre candidature envoyée, vous recevrez une réponse dans un délai de quelques jours à 4 semaines maximum. Si votre candidature est retenue, vous serez contacté(e) pour passer 3 entretiens d’1h chacun répartis de manière suivante :

- 1 entretien sur votre Parcours Académique + une étude de cas

- 1 entretien RH avec Charline, Recruteuse 

- 1 entretien Parcours Professionnel

ref :ESOF145894

apply before : 31 May 2025

## about the role
Vos missions principales en tant qu’architecte Solution seront :
\ Exercer un regard critique face aux enjeux \ Analyser et Réaliser un diagnostic de la situation rencontrée et le synthétiser \ Valoriser et prioriser ainsi qu’identifier les dépendances interprojets \ Mettre en relation les études et l’exploitation en intégrant les contraintes du développement et les exigences de l’exploitation \ Identifier et Communiquer les critères d'arbitrage de solutions et d scénarios  
\ Modéliser les besoins en besoins techniques \ Concevoir des scénarios d’architecture répondant aux exigences client et aux contraintes projets \ Design de plateformes RUN et de solutions de flux avec d’autres applications interfacées \ Rédaction des Dossiers d’Architecture Technique (DAT) \ Accompagnement lors des phases préparatoires au projet \ Calcul des couts et évaluation de l’impact (selon les phases projets) produits mis en œuvre et des frais d’exploitation associés \ Participation à la soutenance des Comités de validation \ Prendre en compte des besoins clients imprécis, ou incomplets, et les transformer en besoins techniques \ Harmonisation et industrialisation des processus et des bonnes pratiques au sein du Pôle d’Architecture en adhésion avec les prescriptions du Groupe
## about you
Compétences techniques:
\ Bonne Connaissance des activités et des technologies de modernisation des architectures et des solutions logicielles \ Connaissance et pratique de l’Architecture logicielle  - Structuration et découpage des applications en composants
\ Bonne connaissance des Solutions technologiques clefs d’une architecture moderne et des modes d’intégration :  - ESB, MDM, BPMN, API, micro services…
\ Maitrise des : - Couches Services (Data et échanges Inter applicatif)

# Politique de confidentialité pour la marque employeur et le recrutement de Trusted Advisors
Date de publication : 07-06-2024
Nous gérons chez Trusted Advisors notre marque employeur ainsi que notre processus de recrutement par le biais de notre (le « Site Carrière »), ainsi qu’avec l’aide d’un système de suivi des candidats.
Dans la présente Politique de confidentialité, nous expliquons comment nous traitons vos données à caractère personnel dans les cas suivants :
La présente Politique de confidentialité décrit également les droits dont vous disposez lorsque nous traitons vos données à caractère personnel, ainsi que la manière dont vous pouvez exercer ces droits.
Lorsque nous utilisons le terme « Candidat » dans la présente Politique de confidentialité, nous faisons référence à chacun des Candidats connectés, Candidats postulants, Candidats sourcés et Candidats coopté, sauf indication contraire.
### 1. À propos du traitement des données à caractère personnel
Les données à caractère personnel désignent toutes les informations qui peuvent être directement ou indirectement liées à une personne physique vivante. Voici quelques exemples de données à caractère personnel : nom, adresse e-mail, numéro de téléphone et adresse IP. Par traitement de données à caractère personnel, il faut entendre toute utilisation automatisée de données à caractère personnel - telles que la collecte, la création, l'analyse, le partage et la suppression de données à caractère personnel.
Des lois et des réglementations régissent la manière dont les entreprises peuvent traiter les données à caractère personnel, appelées lois sur la protection des données. Différentes lois sur la protection des données s'appliquent à différents types d'utilisation de données à caractère personnel, et ce, dans différentes régions du monde. Un exemple important de loi sur la protection des données qui est pertinent pour notre utilisation de vos données personnelles, telle que décrite dans la présente Politique de confidentialité, est le Règlement Général sur la Protection des Données de l'Union européenne (2016/679, RGPD).
La plupart des obligations découlant du RGPD s'appliquent au responsable du traitement. Un responsable du traitement est l'entité qui décide à quelles fins les données à caractère personnel seront traitées et comment le traitement sera effectué. Le responsable du traitement peut faire appel à un sous-traitant de données. Un sous-traitant de données est une entité qui ne peut traiter les données à caractère personnel que selon les instructions du responsable du traitement et ne peut pas utiliser les données à caractère personnel à ses propres fins.
Lorsque nous traitons vos données à caractère personnel, nous assumons le rôle de responsable du traitement tel que décrit dans la présente Politique de confidentialité.
##### Toutes les personnes
Informations sur l'appareil - Si vous visitez notre Site Carrière, nous recueillerons des données sur votre appareil, telles que l'adresse IP, le type et la version du navigateur, le comportement de la session, la source du trafic, la résolution de l'écran, la langue préférée, l'emplacement géographique, le système d'exploitation et les paramètres/l'utilisation de l'appareil. Données techniques et statistiques - Si vous visitez notre Site Carrière nous collecterons des données techniques et statistiques concernant votre utilisation du site, comme les informations sur les URL visitées et votre activité sur le site. Données de communication - Nous recueillerons et conserverons vos communications avec nous, y compris les informations fournies par vous lors de ces échanges. Cela peut inclure, par exemple, le contenu des e-mails, des enregistrements vidéo, des messages sur les réseaux sociaux, les informations que vous ajoutez à votre compte chez nous, les réponses à des enquêtes, etc. Coordonnées - Telles que votre nom, votre adresse e-mail, votre numéro de téléphone ainsi que votre adresse physique.
##### Candidats
##### Toutes les personnes
Du Site d’offres d’emploi. Si vous visitez notre Site d’offres d’emploi, nous recueillons des données techniques et statistiques sur la façon dont vous utilisez le Site d’offres d’emploi, ainsi que des données provenant de votre appareil. Directement de vous. La plupart des informations que nous traitons à votre sujet nous parviennent directement de votre part, par exemple lorsque vous postulez à un poste chez nous ou lorsque vous vous connectez avec nous. Vous avez toujours le choix de ne pas nous fournir certaines informations. Certaines données à caractère personnel sont toutefois nécessaires pour nous permettre de traiter votre candidature ou de vous fournir les informations que vous souhaitez obtenir de notre part.
##### Références
De la part de la personne pour laquelle vous êtes un référent. Si un candidat vous cite comme référent, nous recueillerons vos coordonnées auprès du candidat afin de pouvoir vous contacter.
##### Candidats
##### Protéger et faire respecter nos droits, nos intérêts et ceux d'autrui, notamment dans le cadre d'actions en justice.
Personnes concernées : le ou les individu(s) concerné(s) par la question juridique, pouvant appartenir à toutes les catégories de personnes énumérées ci-dessus.
Catégories de données à caractère personnel utilisées : Toutes les catégories de données à caractère personnel énumérées ci-dessus peuvent être utilisées à cette fin.
##### Le partage de vos données à caractère personnel avec d'autres destinataires, aux fins indiquées à l'article 5 ci-dessous.
Personnes concernées : Cela varie en fonction de l'objectif du partage, voir article 5 ci-dessous.

intro:
PETIT FORESTIER est le leader de la location de matériel frigorifique en Europe.

Créé en 1907 son histoire familiale lui confère une singularité sur le marché qui lui permet d'afficher des chiffres en progression constante : 940 millions d'euros de Chiffre d'Affaires, 5'100 collaborateurs, 300 sites répartis dans 20 pays.

Au sein du Groupe, Petit Forestier Digital Solutions est le Centre De Services nearshore du groupe Petit Forestier.

Crée en 2017, PFDS accompagne le groupe dans sa transformation digitale en offrant un catalogue de services complet (Support applicatif et infrastructure multi-niveaux, Développement, administration et maintenance des systèmes d'informations groupe, Test et qualité logicielle, BI et Data Quality, Cyber sécurité, Business Process Outsourcing)

Pour cette entité, nous recherchons un " Administrateur Rôles et Autorisations SAP (H/F)".

Contexte :
Le groupe Petit Forestier est en forte croissance, à la fois organique et externe avec des acquisitions à l’international. Dans ce contexte, le groupe a lancé un programme ambitieux de transformation (TOM). Il intègre un volet système d’information majeur avec l’implémentation de la solution SAP pour remplacer le cœur du système d’information existant.

Petit Forestier est accompagné d’une assistance à maîtrise d’ouvrage pour construire un modèle opérationnel cible, ainsi que d’un intégrateur SAP pour construire la solution.

Le périmètre SAP couvre les achats, la finance, les contrats, la facturation, la maintenance et la gestion de flotte.

Quel sera votre rôle ?

Vous êtes l'interlocuteur privilégié/Référant pour l'administration des droits SAP sur différents modules : S/4 HANA (FI-CO, SD, MM), FSM (Fleet System Management), SAP Concur

Activités principales :

Définition et maintien de la matrice des rôles et autorisations selon les évolutions des processus métiers en collaboration avec les responsables fonctionnels et experts SAP
Conception, mise en œuvre et évolution des profils utilisateur.
Gestion des rôles simples, dérivés et composites.
Garantir la conformité et le respect des normes
Suivre l'application des notes SAP sécurité en lien avec les autorisations et les outils SAP
Auditer et optimiser les règles liées aux paramètres de sécurité SAP
Mise en place des tests d'intrusion et des contrôles de vulnérabilités du code
Suivi de la sécurisation des bases HANA en termes de gestion des droits et contrôles d’actions sensibles
Assistance aux utilisateurs pour les questions relatives aux autorisations.
Profil et qualifications :

De formation supérieure Bac+5 en informatique
Vous avez une expérience d’au moins 4 ans dans la gestion des autorisations SAP
Connaissances approfondies des aspects liés à la sécurité (confidentialité, sécurisation des systèmes et administration des rôles) et autres solutions de type SIEM et IAM
Compétences techniques et développements selon les technologies (ex ECC, Solutions Manager, dv HANA, Fiori, S4 et BW4HANA)
Être flexible, organisé et méthodique
Capacité de travailler en autonomie et en équipe
Bonne communication orale et écrite en Français. L’anglais est souhaitable

Position:AI Automation Specialist (IT Support)Job Description:Job Summary

The AI Automation Specialist (IT Support) is responsible for analyzing operational workflows, and service delivery processes within IT Support and Managed Services. This role identifies opportunities for automation, workflow improvements, and knowledge management enhancements. The analyst collaborates with cross-functional teams to propose, present, and support the implementation of these initiatives, including leveraging AI-driven solutions and automation tools to enhance service efficiency.

Key Responsibilities

Automation & AI Implementation

Identify and prioritize use cases for automation in IT support and managed services.

Collaborate with customer engagement and technical teams to design, implement, and test automation solutions (e.g., chatbots, RPA, AI-assisted ticketing).

Support the training and fine-tuning of generative AI models for knowledge base enhancement and service optimization.


Knowledge Management & Workflow Enhancement

Coordinate the establishment and continuous improvement of knowledge bases to enable self-service and improve resolution times.

Work with subject matter experts (SMEs) to document best practices, troubleshooting guides, and FAQs.

Ensure integration of knowledge management systems with automation and AI tools.


Cross-Team Collaboration & Change Management

 Work with IT, service delivery, and business stakeholders to align automation initiatives with business goals.

Facilitate training sessions and workshops to drive adoption of automation tools and new processes.

Monitor industry trends and emerging technologies to identify opportunities for continuous improvement.

Required Qualifications & Skills

Education & Experience

Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business Process Management, or a related field (or equivalent experience).

3+ years of experience in service operations, IT support, automation, or process improvement roles.

Experience with IT Service Management (ITSM) tools such as ServiceNow, Zendesk, or Jira Service Management.


Technical & Analytical Skills

Strong understanding of workflow automation, AI-driven support tools, and process optimization methodologies.

Familiarity with automation tools such as Robotic Process Automation (RPA), chatbot platforms, or AI-driven service solutions.

Ability to analyze and interpret data to drive process improvement recommendations.

Soft Skills & Collaboration

Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Problem-solving mindset with a focus on efficiency and user experience.

Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with AI/ML applications in customer support or managed services.

ITIL certification or experience in IT Service Management frameworks.

Knowledge of scripting languages or low-code automation platforms (e.g., Python, Power Automate, UiPath).

Join our dynamic client, a close-knit team of seven remote professionals spread across the globe, in their search for a top-tier Amazon Brand Manager with strong expertise in PPC. This exciting role involves managing three diverse brands in medical supplies, decorations, and clothing, showcasing your ability to drive profitable growth through PPC strategies. One of these brands is https://voilechic.com/.
With 80% of sales coming from just a handful of products, we need a detail-oriented individual well-versed in Amazon ranking, conversion optimization, PPC campaign management, keyword research, and brand analytics (SQP).

Increase Sales & Profit: Develop and execute strategies aimed at boosting overall revenue and profitability for our account.

Manage PPC Campaigns: Strategically plan, implement, and optimize PPC campaigns for efficiency and growth, keeping ACoS and TACoS in mind.
Data Analysis & Reporting: Monitor critical metrics (conversion rates, rankings, keyword relevancy, etc.) and leverage insights from Brand Analytics SQP to inform decisions.
Collaboration & Communication: Work closely with our global team via Slack to share updates, solve problems, and drive results.

3+ Years of Amazon Experience: Proven track record of driving significant growth for Amazon businesses.

intro:
About us

Infomineo is a fast-growing business insights provider, bringing Brainshoring to global clients across a range of services: Business research, Content Services, Graphic Design, and Data Analytics. Our clients include leading Consultancies, Fortune 500 companies, Governments, and NGOs. Infomineo counts 350+ employees spread across 5 offices covering EMEA and the Americas (Casablanca, Cairo, Dubai, Barcelona and Mexico City). 

About this role

Are you intellectually curious? Do you have a knack for solving puzzles? Do you want to make an impact? If yes, this role is right for you. As a Business Research Team Lead at Infomineo, you'll be responsible for performing research, answering clients’ requests and leading a team of analysts in business and investment research needs across different regions and industries.

What you will do

Perform research, answer client requests and autonomously lead a team of analysts and associates in business and investment research
Train, lead and coach a team, clarifying each team member's responsibilities and setting up clear processes
Be the primary contact for our clients, perform QA and set up QA processes for the team ensuring that requests are verified, reliable and up to the very high client standards
Lead and manage different clients, projects and or teams simultaneously, and setting priorities and budget time for each component
Manage a team, clarify objectives, timeline, and responsibilities
Act as professional development coach, by providing coaching, training, constructive feedback, and development career path for the team
Collaborate with the Professional Development team to create and deliver quality training (onboarding and ongoing training)
Ensure a high level of motivation within the team to deliver excellence
Support with the screening selections for the right candidates.
Support to drive different initiatives important to the company
Who you are

Have a master’s degree and a minimum of 4 years of relevant work experience
Have some team management experience
Extensive secondary research experience covering the MENA Region
Able to step back, analyze problems, find solutions, and implement these
Creative and resourceful, with an ability to find information using different tools
Good interpersonal skills and organizational skills, high motivation, an attention to detail, flexibility, and ability to cope under stress, a focus on identifying the solutions to problems
Good management skills with a track record of coordinating workflow and assuring quality for small to medium teams with a strong ability to multitask
Full proficiency in English and French. Any additional language is a real plus
Have expertise with research databases
What we offer

A competitive local salary
Health insurance Benefits
A healthy work-life balance
A steep learning curve with interesting and diverse topics to work on
A great working environment
Don’t hesitate. Apply by clicking on the button. Kindly include a cover letter with your application. We want to learn more about you!

What is it like to work at Infomineo?
If you've spoken with someone who works at Infomineo, you've probably heard that our people are our most valuable asset. Our diversity, both in terms of professional experience and culture, is the company’s greatest strength.

By being a part of Infomineo, you'll have the opportunity to work alongside a friendly, smart, and international team of researchers that value intellectual vitality and creativity. You will learn the best practices, tools to use when conducting primary and secondary research. You will grow your career, expertise across different regions and industries. As a member of the team, you'll be encouraged to contribute by applying your ideas while playing an instrumental role in the company’s development and growth. Within this role, you'll support leading international institutions & companies with the data and information required to fuel key business decisions

Equal opportunity employer

Infomineo is an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any sort of discrimination (based on color, race, sex, sexual orientation, religion, national origin or any other attributes) in all aspects of employment (recruiting, hiring, wages and salary, promotions, benefits, trainings and job termination).

If you believe you match our requirements and values, we would be happy to hear from you. Visit our website to know more about us, our services and company culture.

titre: director  product management, cross border payments
companie: OA- Mastercard
intro:
Our Purpose

Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.

Title and Summary

Director – Product Management, Cross Border PaymentsWho is Mastercard?
Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.
Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.
Overview
Mastercard’s Transfer Solutions team in EEMEA is driving at scale innovation and growth to meet today’s demands for simple, certain, and secure international and domestic payments by individual and businesses of all sizes. Transfer Solutions is a portfolio of integrated assets and capabilities designed to service key verticals, customer segments and multiple payment flows. Through simple connectivity means, we enable partners the ability to reach a variety of endpoints—account, card, mobile wallet, or cash payout—nearly anywhere in the world.

The organization is looking for a Director, Product Management, Cross Border Payments as part of the EEMEA Business Development Team, to work with customers, who are primarily large pan-African Group Banks to further the strategic and commercial agenda of Mastercard in the region, especially around Cross Border Payments, which includes Low Value B2B / Commercial Payments, P2P Remittances and Purpose-based payments like Bill Payments, Tuition Payments, Utility, Social Security etc.

The ideal candidate is aware of the African Payments landscape and is a known name within the circles of Financial Institutions in Africa. He / She must be aware of the intricate dynamics of how money moves across Banks and Borders, especially relating to Correspondent Banking, evolving nature of SWIFT and ISO messaging standards, existing Settlement & Funding Structures, thereby able to identify the existing gaps, and solutionize placing Mastercard assets in the mix with customers. The person must hold adequate subject-matter expertise to hold conversation with banking leaders ranging from Transaction Banking, Treasury, Retail or Payment System Design and drive home desired commercial outcomes for the company.
Role

• This is a PreSales Solutioning roles at its heart where you will work with new prospects and existing clients in providing the commercial and technical solution, to drive sale and launch of Mastercard’s Cross Border Payments asset to the large pan African Banks.
• Own the Sales Solutioning cycle, end-to-end, when working with large / multi-market prospects, positioning Mastercard’s Cross-Border Payments assets, either as a standalone deal or as part of a clubbed multi-product engagement.
• Partner with MA Account Management, and in-country Cross-Border Sales teams during the Sales and / or Implementation Cycle with a Customer and provide deep subject matter expertise required for the opportunity conversion.
• You can either choose to be - Accountable for successful conversion of the opportunity cycle. In short, while you own the Commercial and Techno-Functional Solution, your counterpart teams in MA owns the Relationship and Revenue Realization cycle. OR,
• Alternatively – be accountable to lead, with minimal supervision, the complete Sales and GTM efforts within assigned territories and Accounts, including relationship and full scale PnL responsibilities.
• Internal concept selling within the company, at an Account / Country level, for appropriate customer engagement required to drive conversion. Responsible for driving market adoption of Mastercard’s cross-border solutions, in partnership with the Cluster teams.
• Be able to independently and in teams communicate the needed product capabilities for the markets and clients, and work with various teams within the organization to get them to life.
• Develops and maintains strong working relationships, working closely with cross-functional teams across the organization, to drive the Transfer Solutions agenda.
All About You

The ideal candidate for this position should:
• Have worked in Product Management roles in Cross Border Payments processing teams of large Transaction Banks working in / focused on Africa.
• Alternate, have worked in Sales Solutioning role within Cross Border Payments industry OR Market Infrastructure providers, preferably in Africa.
• Understand and know how NOSTRO pricing works, along with Africa specific challenges of Currency Control, Correspondent De-Risking etc.
• Understand SWIFT, RTGS, ACH, and emerging Multi-lateral payment schemes and the constructs that exists in Africa. Knowledge of alternate technical architecture is a big plus.
• Have firsthand experienced business and sales lifecycle of products and offerings along with prospecting, conversion funnel, launch, and PnL responsibilities.
• Known face in the markets, with existing relationship and credibility to hold deep subject-matter conversations on the topics.
• You enjoy learning new things and can pick up concepts quickly and connect the dots independently without the need of formal & extensive training.
• Demonstrated success working with stakeholders across other business units, functions, and markets in support of cross-functional projects / programs.
Must have strong written and verbal communication skills in English, Arabic and French
Corporate Security Responsibility


All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:

Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;

Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;

Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and

Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

companie: McKinsey & Company
intro:
QUALIFICATIONS

Typically, an undergraduate degree with less than 4 years of work experience; Requirements may vary by country or practice.
Excellent organization capabilities, including the ability to initiate tasks independently and see them through to completion.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English and local office language(s), with the ability to adjust your style to suit different perspectives and seniority levels.
Proficient in rational decision making based on data, facts, and logical reasoning.
Ability to create work product-focused materials / outputs, which may include PowerPoint decks, Excel models, articles, or other written deliverables.
Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment.
Ability to work or attend meetings outside of traditional business hours or take on projects with limited or no notice at times.
Ability to travel to and work in varying environments that may be challenging and/or not accessible (e.g., factories, hospitals, mines).
WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.
In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you’ll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.
When you join us, you will have:
Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package, which includes medical, dental, mental health, and vision coverage for you, your spouse/partner, and children.
WHAT YOU'LL DO

As a business analyst, you will join a client service team and take ownership of a workstream to solve some of the toughest challenges our clients face.
And these aren’t just any clients—they're some of the most influential organizations around, from Fortune 500 giants to innovative startups. We will expect you to go the extra mile, delivering solutions that solve immediate problems and drive long-term change. And we’ll rely on your judgment and integrity to ensure our recommendations are effective and long-lasting.
You will take on a role that goes beyond advising. You’ll be at the heart of the action—helping to uncover the true challenges behind a client’s strategy and creating actionable plans that drive real change. Working alongside clients and other McKinsey colleagues, you’ll combine research, analyzing data, interviews, and brainstorming to generate fresh insights and breakthrough solutions. Your commitment to our values will be crucial in earning our clients' trust and delivering results that matter.
As you collaborate directly with clients, you’ll help them solve problems, refine strategies, and implement transformations. By equipping them with the tools and knowledge to continue innovating and improving after we’ve left, you’ll ensure the impact of our work endures. In doing so, you’ll uphold McKinsey’s commitment to making a meaningful difference in the industries and communities we serve.

As a business analyst intern, you will join a client service team for 8-10 weeks, contributing to workstreams to help solve some of the toughest challenges our clients face.
And these aren’t just any clients—they're some of the most influential organizations around, from Fortune 500 giants to innovative startups. We will expect you to go the extra mile, delivering solutions that solve immediate problems and drive long-term change. And we’ll rely on your judgment and integrity to ensure our recommendations are effective and long-lasting.
You will take on a role that goes beyond advising. You’ll be at the heart of the action—helping to uncover the true challenges behind a client’s strategy and creating actionable plans that drive real change. Working alongside clients and other McKinsey colleagues, you’ll combine research, analyzing data, interviews, and brainstorming to generate fresh insights and breakthrough solutions. Your commitment to our values will be crucial in earning our clients' trust and delivering results that matter.
As you collaborate directly with clients, you’ll help them solve problems, refine strategies, and implement transformations. By equipping them with the tools and knowledge to continue innovating and improving after we’ve left, you’ll ensure the impact of our work endures. In doing so, you’ll uphold McKinsey’s commitment to making a meaningful difference in the industries and communities we serve.

companie: McKinsey & Company
intro:

Typically enrolled in advanced graduate degree program (e.g., MBA, PhD, etc.); Requirements may vary by country or practice.
Excellent organization capabilities, including the ability to initiate tasks independently and see them through to completion.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English and local office language(s), with the ability to adjust your style to suit different perspectives and seniority levels.
Proficient in rational decision making based on data, facts, and logical reasoning.
Ability to create work product-focused materials / outputs, which may include PowerPoint decks, Excel models, articles, or other written deliverables.
Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment.
Ability to work or attend meetings outside of traditional business hours or take on projects with limited or no notice at times.
Ability to travel to and work in varying environments that may be challenging and/or not accessible (e.g., factories, hospitals, mines).
WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.
In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you’ll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.
When you join us, you will have:
Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package, which includes medical, dental, mental health, and vision coverage for you, your spouse/partner, and children.
